book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: A Kitchen Masterpiece
review:
I just had a chance to sit down for an hour of sheer pleasure, perusing my new cookbook. I've been a devotée of Carolyn's blog for a long time, and this book is a worthy amplification of her daily posts.

The first thing that strikes the reader is the beauty of the photography. Each recipe, on the left page as you open the book, is pictured gorgeously on the opposite page. This is especially important to many who want to know ahead of time what they can expect. Many cooks are visual. Presentations are styled elegantly, most photographed with a minimalist, stylish white background. This book is a feast for the eyes, equal to the feast that the recipes represent.

Carolyn thoughtfully included just what you'd expect of a cookbook that includes the word "everyday" in the title. She starts with a primer on ingredients with which the reader will want to stock a low carb pantry, frequently used equipment to make your ketogenic journey easier, and sample menus. From here, she transitions into the recipes. Basics such as broths, marinades, rubs, syrups and sauces start off the culinary love fest. From there, many creative breakfast options are explored, including items many think are verboten on a keto diet, such as waffles, pancakes, fruit syrups, and coffee cake. Carolyn demonstrates that eating keto doesn't mean that common cliché of having to start your day with a dreary parade of eggs, eggs, and more eggs.

Bread substitutes follow, with such delights as skillet "cornbread," Apple Cider Donut Bites, flatbread, scones, and crackers.

The appetizer chapter gets very uptown, with such selections as Grilled Zucchini Rolls With Goat Cheese and Pesto, Bacon and Sundried Tomato Truffles, and Smoked Salmon Pinwheels. Yet more prosaic snacks are well represented, with must-haves, such as graham crackers and nacho chips.

The soup/salad chapter beckons the reader to make such delights as Italian Wedding Soup, Spinach Artichoke Soup, and Fried Goat Cheese Salad.

Meats are the subject of the next chapter, with beef, pork, and lamb selections. Some are gussied up, like Pork Medallions With Browned Butter and Crispy Sage, and reliable faves such as dry rub ribs, pulled pork, and slow cooker kielbasa and cabbage.

Chicken and egg entrées are grouped together with recipes like Cordon Bleu roll-ups, quiche and frittata. There's even a goat cheese soufflé for the stylish!

Seafood is well represented, with many out-of-the-ordinary offerings, like Broccoli Drunken Noodles With Shrimp and Fish Saltimbocca. But those looking for crab cakes or crispy fish nuggets won't be disappointed. The following chapter addressing side dishes is extensive, including directions for making the popular zucchini "noodles," and how to make cauliflower rice. Vegetables get roasted, baked, and deep fried.

Although Carolyn knows her stuff on every one the preceding subjects, her real forte is in amazing her readers with a never-ending parade of delicious desserts. So many think that keeping low carb means bidding adios to yummy desserts. Carolyn is adept at dismissing such ill-conceived notions, and this book underscores her talents. I have tried so many desserts on her blog, all with excellent results. Here, she thrills the reader with mousses, cheesecakes, sauces, ice creams, cookies, and brownies. And, did I mention CHOCOLATE?? No one does it better. Her white chocolate raspberry fat bombs are truly to die for!

The directions are unfailingly clear and accessible, for those who aren't confident of their culinary skills. As a classically trained chef, I find her recipes organized and always methodically presented. This cookbook is more of what I've come to expect of her. Her style is fun and familiar, like you're learning from a friend.

This tome would be a superb gift for the low carb wanna-be to get him/her excited about the possibilities of maintaining a keto lifestyle. They will find themselves up and off the couch, into the kitchen. Moreover, it's a valuable, comprehensive resource for those of us who are old hands. It's even supremely useful for those who want to start on a healthier way of life, and aren't sure where or how to begin. In other words, there is no one who enjoys time in the kitchen who won't welcome this book. It would make a splendid Christmas, wedding, housewarming, or birthday gift. Carolyn isn't preachy. She never tries to proselytize. With recipes such as those contained in this book, she doesn't need to. She has presented a thoughtful, convincing solution. She leads us to the discovery of how to achieve boundless good health. Herein, she demonstrates how easy it can be and IS to keep low carb, simply and deliciously.

Congratulations, Carolyn! You have created a true modern kitchen masterpiece.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: The Best Keto Coobook EVAH!
review: This cookbook is the BEST Keto cookbook, Ever! I have already made several recipes and followed Carolyn and her site before. She knows her stuff and makes food fun and delicious again for the whole family! I bought extra copies for friends and will continue to share. I made the butter pecan cookies and the brownies for our Neighbors at Christmas. They loved them. A little tip: if you forget the baking powder in the coconut oil brownie recipe, it turns out to be yummy fudge! A pleasant result. Still have not made with baking powder yet. I really should. I made the cinnamon rolls for a church breakfast and they were a huge hit. I always go to Carolyn’s site when looking for new recipes. It has been wonderful having the cookbook right in front of me. Beautiful pictures. Very easy to understand recipes. Her tips at the bottom of each recipe are extremely helpful. (I did add extra swerve to the brownie/fudge recipe) I have been eating the Keto way for almost 2 years. I have lost 40 pounds. My triglycerides were almost 400, they are down to 138. My blood pressure is normal again. It took one year and four months for my blood pressure to go back to normal, but it is there!!!! All the while, I eat bacon, butter, mayo on pretty much everything. I am not sure what my blood sugar was prior to changing the way I eat, but I am sure it was not good. Being told that I had to go on a statin woke me up to make the necessary changes. I did not take statins, ever. My health changed completely all because of my diet. Thank you, Carolyn for helping me all along the way. ❤️

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: You need this book!!
review: This cookbook is a treasure! What a work of art! The contents of this book makes this more than just a cookbook! It has great tips and information all about low carb cooking. There is information on how to stock your pantry, Information on Keto ingredients, info on swaps, info on kitchen cookware, and baking tips! Carolyn writes from the heart in this book and you can feel her sincerity and warmth! Oh and the recipes are all drool worthy for sure! The pictures make you want to run into your kitchen and start cooking! You won't be able to pick what you want to cook first! I just love this book I love the easy recipes with step by step clear instructions and at the end of each recipe Carolyn included an "everyday tip". The recipes are simple and easy to follow with easy to find ingredients too. If your looking for a fabulous cookbook this is the one to get and if your looking to add to your collection this is one to add for sure! I could not contain myself and had to make something! I decided to make her Cannoli tart and let me tell you it is the real deal!!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Five Stars
review: Brilliant!!! I love this cookbook!! You will not be disappointed. I bought the PC for Kindle version because I could not wait, did not want to wait for delivery. It is packed with recipes that I will use all the time from everyday meals to elegant dinner parties-- appetizers, sides, soups, main dishes, desserts, and more. Unlike some of the other keto or low carb cookbooks written by other authors, the majority of ingredients for the recipes can be bought locally, which is a deciding factor when you live in a small, rural, country town. The cookbook is family friendly, filled with recipes even children will enjoy. Included are perfectly stepped and conveyed instructions with beautiful pictures. Carolyn also adds her personal touches by sharing her life stories, tips, and tricks that she has learned throughout her journey in this WOE. I am so excited to see what she is going to write and publish next.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: This Cookbook Brought Me Back To Low-Carb Eating.
review:
I have been following Carolyn on "All Day I Dream About Food" for quite some time now. I had great results using her recipes, but left keto low-carb eating a few years ago, with, as you might have guessed, disastrous results; I gained about 30 lbs. So when I decided I'd had enough and was ready to return to ketogenic eating, I was thrilled that Carolyn has come out with a new cookbook. I have to say, I'm very picky about who I embrace as a food blogger. First the recipes have to make sense, and be intelligently written. A big pet peeve is when the ingredients are not listed in order of use. That's a big no-no for me, it's very frustrating to make something and then discover a key ingredient was left out, because it wasn't mentioned until the bottom of the list. Carolyn has never disappointed in that regard. Also I appreciate that she researches her topics and really knows what she's talking about. I have tried so many recipes in this cookbook, it's already got grease stains and water spots on the pages. I had wanted to keep it nice and clean, but if you use a favorite cookbook frequently it will get messy.
My only complaint, and this is just me. Where are some of my favorites from the website? Like, Stromboli, Reubens, Low-carb Nutella, Pavlovas, Almond Crusted Butter Cake, Hungarian Goulash, etc., etc?? Only one thing left to do, Carolyn.....come out with Volume Two! Thanks to the recipes in this wonderful book, and Carolyn's humor and guidance, I've dropped 8 pounds in the past week. It's a good start, with more to come, I'm sure.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: So good! And so full of practical advice for both ...
review: So good! And so full of practical advice for both the rookie Keto person and also those more experienced with the lifestyle. Carolyn Ketchum's recipes are always stellar. Pictured are the Easy Peanut Butter Cups I've been making since Carolyn shared the recipe a while back to whet readers' appetites for the book's release. SO GOOD!! Can't wait to cook/bake everything in this book. Highly recommended!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: I LOVE this cookbook
review: I LOVE this cookbook. I purchased another very popular Ketogenic Cookbook and immediately returned it. I couldn't see myself making more than a few of the recipes - they were way too complicated. This cookbook allowed me to order some ingredients that I saw were regularly used, as well as a few utensils that I knew would be helpful, and I am ready to roll. There's info at the beginning that was a great help in assisting me in reorganizing my pantry. Also many of the recipes I find on line or in the other cookbooks are way too high in protein. This cookbook as a lot of moderate protein recipes included AND it has suggestions for making substitutions for those who may want to prepare a dish without dairy etc. It is really organized well! The recipes look delicious and also seem simple to follow. Thanks Carolyn for this great resource and making it easy for busy professionals like myself. I recommend the Everday Ketogenic Kitchen for anyone looking for great low carb, moderate protein, and high fat recipes! I will update my post after I try a few recipes with more feedback!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: WOW! Buy it!!! Every recipe is delicious!!
review: This is everything you need in a good Keto cookbook! I have followed Carolyn for years making the wonderful recipes she posts on her blog. I was so happy to hear she had a cookbook coming out and I was NOT disappointed! I have never made a recipe of Carolyn's I have not loved! I have made so many recipes from this book already (having the broccoli cheese soup and "cornbread" for dinner tonight) but we eat everything up so fast it is hard to remember to take a photo! I did snap several of the Brie and Mushroom Quiche (WONDERFUL!) I also loved the chocolate haystacks (my little granddaughter was a big fan) and the chocolate/pecan muffins. Basically... buy the book! You will not be disappointed! Thank you, Carolyn, for this wonderful resource!**** UPDATE Just made the "breaded" goat cheese rounds for our salads tonight. WOW! I am a goat cheese lover and I didn't even need any dressing! My salad was THAT good! (So good that I ate half of it before I snapped the photo! Sorry!)

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Crazy about this book!
review: There are not even words for how much I love this cookbook! My husband had a heart attack 10 months ago, and our doctor recommended a keto lifestyle to combat his ridiculously high triglyceride levels. I have used Carolyn's recipes on a nearly daily basis, both from her blog and now this delicious cookbook, and we have seen amazing results! I'm down 50 lbs, my husband has lost nearly 80 lbs and his cholesterol levels are better than they have ever been! He's off all statins and only on one BP medication. Also, these recipes are delicious and when we have dinner guests, nobody knows that they're eating "keto." Seriously, buy this book! Live this lifestyle! You will not regret it!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Excellent Ketogenic Cookbook Reference
review: Read it last night - fantastic! Will definitely become my go to reference for low carb recipes. Seems very doable & wasn't as restrictive as I thought a ketogenic diet would be. I actually feel relief that this is the method I have been migrating to after going back & forth between GF & Paleo, but Carolyn did all the work for me & is making the journey attainable-thank you. Please write more books like this that have common ingredients, easy instructions & satisfying taste too. Also, great idea including a variety of staple beverages which I think are important to this lifestyle. I'm excited to get cooking. 🙂

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: YAY! BEST LOW-CARB KETO RECIPE BOOK YOU CAN BUY!
review: YAY! I was so thrilled that Carolyn Ketchum finally made a keto recipe book! For years I printed-off her awesome recipes from my computer, and longed for an easy to use cookbook. Why? Because her recipes are simply the best tasting low-carb keto friendly recipes out there! Tonight I made the Chocolate Chip Cookies and they are great! I used Lily's Chocolate Chips. (You can get them off Amazon if your health food store doesn't carry them.) She explains that you can use duck fat to make them dairy-free, or if dairy is not an issue you can use butter, and I used butter. I love that she has tips and swaps you can use on many of the recipes. Lots of amazing photos for every recipe. I've bought so many low-carb and keto books over the years, but her recipes are the ones I've made the most because they all taste great! This is my favorite cookbook that I own. All her recipes are tried and true and taste wonderful. Some low carb recipe books have terrible tasting recipes but not this one. Also, she uses Swerve sweetener for a lot of recipes and the swerve tastes better than other Erythritol products I've tried. (I order the Swerve Sweetener off Amazon too.)

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: A 5-Star cookbook
review:
Whether you follow a low-carb/Keto lifestyle or not, this is a cookbook you’ll want to have. I’ve followed Carolyn’s blog for years and have filled notebooks and my iPad with her recipes—recipes I turn to all the time. I feared her cookbook might contain primarily recipes from her site—I should have known better. Nearly every recipe is brand new. The photos are mouthwatering, and so are the finished products. My favorite section is the photo index. Arranged by category, it features a thumbnail pic of every recipe..

There’s only 1 thing missing, a dessert recipe that features pumpkin. But my iPad is stuffed with tried and true pumpkin cakes, pumpkin bars, pumpkin cupcakes, pumpkin everything else from her blog, so it’s easy to get my pumpkin fix. You will love this cookbook, and once you stop drooling over the photos, you will actually use it.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: BUY IT!
review: I’ve been following Carolyn online for a few years now and hesitated to buy this book because she has so many great recipes already available online. But just before it’s release, I caved and pre-ordered this book and I’m SO glad I did. This book is substantial, beautifully photographed, and chock full of amazing recipes you won’t find online. I’ve had the book only a few days and I’ve already made half a dozen recipes and my whole family has loved every one (I just finished making the cream cheese waffles and blueberry syrup for breakfast - YUM!) Carolyn is EXTREMELY talented and her concoctions make “dieting” feel like a decadent splurge! Don’t hesitate, buy it! I can’t wait for her to write another one! Thank you, Carolyn!!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: The recipes are clear and easy to follow with lovely pictures to help you see ...
review: This is a must have cookbook! It is the replacement for our "Joy of Cooking" from our previous high carb life. You won't miss your old eating life style at all. I've already made several recipes and I've only had the book a few days! The recipes are clear and easy to follow with lovely pictures to help you see what the end product should look like. Plenty of staple recipes plus quite a few fun ones. My kids even love when I make her recipes. None of the recipes use out of the ordinary ingredients for a ketogenic pantry. If you are new to this way of eating, Carolyn gives very clear guidelines on how to stock your pantry and kitchen in the first part of the book. I love the helpful tables that compare different types of ingredients. I especially find the section on how and why different "flours" work or don't work, and why certain ingredients are important. I highly recommend this book, you won't be disappointed!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: An honest review
review:
I've been following All Day I Dream About Food author and blogger Carolyn Ketchum, for over a year now. I subscribe to many other low carb and keto bloggers that are also great. My main reason for following her was the low carb desserts she made and the consistently good recipe results I always achieved from her blog. Her blog is well written, consistent in style, content and layout, it's easy to follow and her directions are thorough without unnecessary verbiage. I personally don't like cooking videos unless it's crucial to show unusual steps to achieve an end result. Most are an annoying waste of time and I still need to rely on the written recipe. I appreciate that she keeps hers to a minimum. The book is beautiful, well written, informative about the keto diet, nutrition in general and includes an accurate description of why the modern American diet is so horrendous. You cannot go wrong with this book, it deserves more than the maximum 5 stars.

As I said though, I followed her originally for the baked goods and dessert recipes, because honestly, there are already a ton of fantastic, non dessert recipes on the interwebs. But Carolyn has a unique ability to create solidly consistent desserts that are excellent, not just pretty good, and she does this better (sorry) than all the other low carb bloggers that are very popular. This isn't meant to offend, its just a fact. So, that all said, I was kind of disappointed in the dessert catagory. I expected to see a fair number of some of her most popular desserts like her Apple Coffee Cake with Caramel sauce, etc. But instead there are 3 fatbomb recipes, 1 gummy recipe, chocolate chips recipe, chocolate ganache, chocolate sauce, the latter 3 which are not desserts but dessert condiments. Those could easily have been included as side bars instead of devoting 2 pages for each of them. She did however include a lovely NY Cheesecake, Chocolate Lava cakes for 2 and the Gingerbread cake roll, along with a few others. I know many of her desserts can be printed but it's not at all the same as having them in a beautiful book format. It still deserves high praise, but she also said she wants honest reviews, this is mine.

She has just announced a new book coming out in March 2018 for Easy Keto dinners, which is very exciting. As someone that must eat keto because I am diabetic, new and easy ways to prepare and enjoy food that doesn't harm you, this is welcome news. But not everyone loves Cauliflower, some of us actually loathe the vile plant. Please bear in mind that you have already included no less than 3 Cauliflower recipes in this book. There's also a vast, overabundance of Cauliflower recipes infecting the internet. Thought for Food.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Handsdown WONDERFUL cookbook
review:
I have to admit when I saw 98% 5-star reviews, I did wonder if Amazon had somehow been snookered with a fake-review bomb. But NO. This cookbook is handsdown WONDERFUL. To start with, Ketchum gives an easily-understandable mini-course in the Keto diet in a very readable yet science-based manner. (Since I happen to totally appreciate evidence-based and science-based information, ahem, this portion of the book I love.) Also, the organization is fabulous and easy to use, and the photographs are extremely accurate. I am cooking my way through this cookbook with sheer joy. Many thanks to this wonderful lady for sharing her love of food, her understanding of a busy life, and her obviously vast amount of research with those of us who want optimum health and who love the world of taste and cooking.

This is one of the best cookbooks in my 100+ library. In fact, although I have not cooked all of the recipes in it at this date, I think it may be my favorite.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Thank you Carolyn!!
review: This cookbook is amazing!! Carolyn makes this whole dieting business actually doable and I'm feeling like some kind of gourmet chef!! 2 previous impossibilities!! Seriously, the recipes in here are even doable for a kitchen reject like myself and even my family is eating everything without a clue it is keto!!! I am so thankful to be able to eat fabulous amazing food even after being diagnosed with pre-diabetes!! Carolyn, thanks and big hugs from ohio!! To everyone else, give this book a try, you will absolutely love it!!💖💖💖💖💖💖💖

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: This is THE BEST Keto cookbook I have seen!
review:
I own 10 Keto cookbooks and this one is my favorite! The recipes are clearly written and Carolyn offers a lot of great tips for each one. For people with food allergies, she gives suggestions for alternative ingredients for some of the recipes. All of the recipes have beautiful color photos. Most of the recipes are written on one page with the photo on the opposite page. The few recipes that require two pages are written on two facing pages - no page turning required while you're cooking. She includes nutritional information for each recipe.

The Easy Taco Pie is fantastic! The recipe serves 8 and there are just 2 of us so I cut it in half and baked it in a 6-inch pie plate. It worked great and we had enough for dinner and delicious leftovers to heat up for lunch the next day.

I've got so many sticky notes on recipes that I'm eager to try, including Creamy Spinach and Mushroom Gratin, Easy Peanut Butter Cups, Apple Cider Donuts, Hamburger Buns, and Sheet Pan Chicken and Veggies. (A friend of mine made the Sheet Pan Chicken and Veggies and said it is outstanding!)

If you're looking for new low carb or keto recipes this is a great one to add to your collection!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Delicious, creative recipes that are still easy to prepare
review:
I’ve had this book for less than a week, and I am already thrilled with it. So far, I have made the Easy Taco Pie and the Maple Bacon Pancake Muffins. Both were easy and turned out delicious.

I can see myself using these recipes long into the future, even if I am no longer doing keto. The Maple Bacon Pancake Muffins taste just like their name, and are so creative but simply delicious! Something I can see making for guests many times.

Looking forward to cooking many more recipes from the book! It is beautifully designed and well organized, a pleasure to use.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Thanks to this book, I am the Keto Queen!
review:
I borrowed this book from the library for 1 month to see if it was worth buying. I tried about 1/4 of the recipes and surprisingly most of them are outstanding! I have now made over half the recipes in the book and there are some clear winners and losers. Bad news first. If you have your heart set on cinnamon rolls, don’t use this recipe, it’s so incredibly disappointing; as is the “corn bread” and chocolate crepes. Gross. The almond crust tart tastes amazing but it is very crumbly. Now for the good part. I can freaking eat bread again and it actually tastes like the real thing!!!! The Thai Chicken Zoodle Soup, Italian Wedding Soup, Taco Pie (terrible name, awesome meal), Raspberry Ricotta Breakfast Cake, Red Wine Braised Shortribs, Lasagna Stuffed Peppers, Cauliflower Grits, Peanut Butter Cups, cheesecake, (yes, cheesecake—you will not miss the crust, I promise) etc... All fantastic. I scoffed when I saw the Cream Cheese Waffle recipe because I LOVE waffles. My hopes were not high with just nearly surviving the great chocolate crepe debacle (dry heave). However, the waffles are to die for! I don’t think I will make my boys waffles the standard way ever again.😍
The lemon poppyseed bread is glorious! The Sunflower bread divine, thanks to this keto book, I am looking damn fine!!!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: YES!!!
review: Fantabulous! I've been following Carolyn for awhile, and her recipes are always amazing. I pre-ordered the book, and was so excited to receive it! I had company over a couple days later, so I made the whole meal from recipes in the book. It was a big hit! And BTW, no one except us does low carb, but I didn't say anything and I don't think they noticed. ;) They raved about how delicious it all was! The book is beautifully laid out, has gorgeous photography, and is full of amazing recipes. Highly recommend!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Love this book!
review: I just received this today, so haven’t made anything yet, but there are so many wonderful recipes in this book! And what I’m really liking is most use everyday ingredients, and won’t break the bank to make them. There are so many I’m excited to try! Dinner tommorow is the chicken cordon bleu roll ups. They sound delicious and easy! It’s a beautiful book with color photos of every recipe.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Best and most favorite cookbook I own. A must in any Keto kitchen.
review: My husband ordered this for me on Amazon, and it's the first cookbook I reach for when I'm looking for something to make. I just threw together her Raspberry Ricotta Breakfast Cake, pages 104 and 105. Took me about 10 minutes to pull out the ingredients and combine. So simple and easy you could have your kids or grand kids help you make it. I used frozen blueberries, because that's what I had on hand, but I'm sure it would taste just as good with raspberries. That's one of the things I love about Carolyn's recipes, they are adaptable. If you don't have an item, but something similar, the recipe turns out great with the substitution. I have tried out many of her recipes from the book and I have loved them all. Think I'll make her Duck Fat Chocolate Chip Cookies, pages 324 and 325, again. LOVE these. By the way, the photos get a 5 star all on their own. Absolutely beautiful!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Superb Cookbook Highly Recommended
review:
Carolyn Ketchum’s awesome new cookbook was worth the wait. This is one cookbook that makes want to prep every recipe in the book.
The recipes are easy to make, utterly delicious, and the format makes one want to spend the day cooking one delicious dish after another. Having a color photo of the dish is an additional incentive to try the recipe. Also very helpful is the photo list by subject in the back of the book. I use that rather than the index to locate a recipe. Definitely one of my favorite cookbooks. And certainly the one I will use the most. When can we expect a second volume?

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Excellent Cookbook for Beginners and Long-time Keto-ers Alike!
review: Love this book! The recipes are simple, delicious and contain mostly easily available ingredients (all can be found here on Amazon, if not in your local groceries), all with beautiful photos of the finished dish. Carolyn explains how the diet (which means "way of eating") works, whether you want to use it for weight loss, disease control or basic health. Loaded with everyday meals that even people not on a ketogenic diet will love. Carolyn is one of the best ketogenic diet bloggers on the interwebz today, and has some of the best recipes you can find. One of the things that makes her stand out from others is her ability to do recipe conversions of typical unhealthy high carb, low fat recipes to make them fit into a ketogenic lifestyle. Contains dairy alternatives as well, if you cannot tolerate or are avoiding dairy.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: What an amazing tool for a successful Keto journey!
review: I just received my book in the mail and I'm only on the spices section but I'm already obsessed with this book. I have been on and off keto for a year so I am no expert, but this literally has everything you need to know in one handy little guide. Over the past year I have been relying heavily on Pinterest on Facebook for recipes and advice and it all becomes a little overwhelming. This is like the Keto Bible! Everything is so organized and so well written. I love that you included weight measurements in your baking recipes because my OCD with baking can get a little crazy if it's not an exact measurement. I'm going to get back to reading, but I just wanted to stop by real quick and tell you how helpful this will be for me.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: No-Brainer / Wise Purchase
review: Great Keto recipes. Pictures are great. Love the picture index in back. I've made the brie mushroom quiche countless times, it is so fricking easy and delicious. I even modified by adding some ham and using zucchini instead of mushrooms and it came out just as good. The lemon poppy seed bread/cake is a replacement for an old high sugar/high carb toxic family treat (I almost cried the first time I made it and realized it was my HFLC replacement). Her recipes are a lot like her blog - simple, real food, low carb, so easy to understand and designed for those of us that don't have hours to spend in the kitchen. This is one of the only cookbooks I've ever purchased that I am still super happy I purchased months later. Disclainer: heavy dairy and I have not tried to sub dairy in recipes for alternatives so can't comment from that POV. I was hesitant to purchase because her blog is so easy to use and save recipes from but I love having the hard copy on my kitchen counter for reference. This purchase is seriously a no-brainer IMO.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Wonderful Low Carb Cookbook!
review:
What a beautiful cookbook! I've been following Carolyn's blog for years and have loved everything I've made from her recipes, so I was really looking forward to the publication of her cookbook. It does not disappoint!

The recipes are well-written and easy to follow, and I love that the nutrition information is included for each one. Her explanations of ingredients and their roles in low carb cooking and baking are an invaluable reference. And there is a little treat in the back of the book—thumbnails of the photographs for each of the recipes, all organized by chapter and page. It makes it really easy to find the recipes that are in the book without having to page through to remind yourself of what's there. I'll be working my way through the entire book for the next few months!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Fantastic Cookbook!
review:
There are quite a few Keto and low-carb cookbooks in my collection, as I I've been living this lifestyle for about 3 years now. Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen has quickly become the one I reach for the most. It is well laid out with beautiful photos of each recipe, nutritional and possible substitutions info, and so far everything I've made has been really really good. But where I think this cookbook stands out for me is the collection of baking recipes. Both savory and sweet, scones, breads crusts, desserts, you name it. There is even a recipe here for "Cornbread" for crying out loud! No doubt about it, Carolyn can bake like nobody's business! I personally am not a good baker, and low-carb only complicates things for me even more, but I've managed to recreate some recipes and even get my 13 year old to compliment them. Instructions are simple and ingredients are ones you probably already have in your pantry if you've been low-carbing before.

If you are brand new to Ketogenic way of eating, there isn't a whole lot of info here on the science behind it, or an in depth overview of ingredients, good vs bad, only the basic concepts. But if you're starting out and are overwhelmed by the choices of cookbooks out there, I would definitely recommend this one for the recipes alone.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Absolutely fantastic!
review:
So I've been a fan of All Day I dream about Food for a while now and let me say this book did not disappoint! My family andI have been enjoying all these recipes. Did I mention my family? Yes! My kids will eat these recipes without picking them apart and ask for them again! The Sheppard pie is to die for- I man so good I had it for breakfast! Iwent to a dinner party Saturday taking both the canoli tart and the tiramisu cups and they were a hit. Even my boss who is always suspicious of my food because he isn't a fan of gluten free lived it and his wife asked for the recipe.
I never write reviews and I am die hard Amazon purchaser but I had to write one for this because it's just that awesome! I pre-ordered Craveable Keto and can't wait for it to come out!!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Keto Heaven
review: Wow! First, I would like to say that Carolyn is a keto genius. Her recipes are simple but delicious (sometimes those are mutually exclusive). I follow her All Day I Dream About Food Facebook page and am delighted to say these are new recipes. I am also happy to see nutrition info for each recipe which is important for tracking macro's. I'm just hoping her next cookbook is all about keto desserts.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Great recipes and diet info
review: I have been a big fan of Carolyn's recipe blog for a couple of years, and I was not disappointed by the cookbook. The book begins with wonderful explanations of the ketogenic diet - what it is, how it works, why it's healthy - and of the ingredients that are often used in the recipes. The recipes themselves are very straightforward and involve little to no fuss. The pictures are great. This is quickly becoming my most turned to resource for daily food inspiration.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Fantastic cookbook!!
review:
Wow! I don't normally purchase a cookbook, but because I have so loved all of Carolyn Ketchum's recipes and follow her blog faithfully, I knew I wanted to purchase this. And it did not disappoint! It arrived and I immediately found a recipe that I had all the ingredients for (Spinach Artichoke Soup) and made it for dinner. Fantastic! I've always felt like I could make and serve one of Carolyn's recipes to guests without trying it out before hand, because they are foolproof and always deliciousl

The recipes are wonderful, the pictures are fantastic, and the possible substitutions if you need to avoid dairy are are very helpful.
I've already tagged a large number of these recipes to try in the coming days.

So whether you are new to Ketogenic eating or have been eating this way for a long time, you will LOVE this cookbook

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Love this cookbook!
review: I received my copy of Carolyn’s new cookbook last week. I have fallen in love with all her new recipes. I have been following her on Facebook & and I have say that I have been successfully making her recipes for a number of years. Even my husband and friends eat her recipes and enjoy them even though gluten-free sugar free is not their usual diet. I have already made the peanut butter cups on page 301. They are unbelievably delicious and so easy to make. All of the recipes in her book will be made by me in the coming year. She also lists calories and nutritional information with each recipe.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Choose this Keto cookbook FIRST! You really are as healthy as you eat!
review:
I do not think that I have found a recipe book before that has SO MANY recipes that I am looking forward to trying. (Usually I think it is a success if I find say ten for the whole book. )
It is so well laid-out. Nutritional info and a photo on Each recipe. Substitution suggestions. Very easy, no ridiculously fancy ingredients...simply stuff that most Keto kitchens already have. Equipment suggestions. Keto diet explanation and the health issues that it helps resolve. Oh and the sweetener chart!! I can not say enough good things about this cook book!
I would suggest before any other recipe to make the Magic Mozzarella Dough. It is so versatile from pizza to cinnamon rolls!
I have to ask the author: How about a Holiday Keto Cookbook?
I seriously can not wait to see what she publishes next!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Don't question it..YOU NEED this book!
review:
I've followed this keto chef for a while now. I usually save all my recipes on my phone (I have an awesome app that saves recipes from the web or even photos like when they post awesome goodies on Instagram) Anyway I kept telling myself I don't need to buy a cookbook. There are so many free recipes out there why do I need one!

WELL, LADIES AND GENTS, HOW WRONG WE ARE! YOU NEED THIS COOKBOOK! I took advantage of prime day and snagged this baby with a $5 off coupon (WHOOT WHOOT)

This book has a bit of everything! I'm sold and can't wait to get more of her books! I've been keto for almost a year now and I pretty much have EVERYTHING ALREADY! No need to run out for 10 ingredients for one recipe. They are easy to follow, many are items you would already have on hand, and ALL OF THEM ARE SUPER YUMMY! I can't believe I didn't get this sooner. I could have been eating SO GOOD for even longer! (let's be honest, some of those keto chefs don't know what they are doing.) And many keto ingredients are not cheap, so why waste them on sub-par recipes! Carolyn Ketchum knows what's she's doing and I couldn't be happier!!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: hate it.
review: I HAAAAAAAAAATE cooking, hate it...h.a.t.e. I think you get what I'm saying. This cookbook has made the start of this diet very bearable! I'm actually looking forward to making more stuff (especially trying a few desserts). The stuffed peppers were okay, nothing amazing (peppers are always runny when you cook them), but the eggplant parmesan is INSANELY good. So far, the dinner recipes have not let us down. I really wasn't interested in the desserts, because I'm trying to curb my sweet tooth, but I think I may try a few of them (hopefully they won't trigger more of my sweet tooth - we shall see). Most of the reviews seemed to be about desserts, so I was very skeptical. I do wish the sample week of keto meals would have been more helpful (not just putting down dinner recipe left-overs for breakfast, shared a detailed coffee recipe, etc.), but I figured it out. FYI, a great coffee/mocha recipe (aka my breakfast): 1 shot of espresso, 1T MCT oil, 2T collagen powder, 2T heavy whipping cream, 1T unsweetened cocoa powder, and 1T swerve sweetener (thank you for the Swerve recommendation!). It's amazing, and I'm not hungry until nearly 1pm!!! (Nearly 5 hours later!). Anyway, I highly recommend the book. It's fun to learn some great recipes that I can have in my back pocket with/without the Keto diet.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Great Keto Resource!
review:
Carolyn Ketchum has been one of my favorite Keto bloggers for years and I've used many of her recipes from her blog All Day I Dream About Food. So when she said she was writing a cookbook I couldn't preorder fast enough! Since I got my paperback copy, I've ordered another as a gift and also added the Kindle book to my cooking library as well as the paperback.

Carolyn starts by explaining what a Keto diet is (it's not really a "diet" but a WOE --- a way of eating --- that promotes health and weight loss. She tells you what ingredients you can expect to use in the recipes. And finally, these recipes are easy to make and her directions are very clear, so whether you've been cooking Keto for a while or you're brand new at it you will find plenty of good food to keep you successful on your way of eating.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Brilliant Go-To Book for all Low Carb and Gluten Free Recipes
review:
Carolyn's blog has been my go-to place when needing inspiration for gluten free and low carb recipes for a number of years, so I was thrilled to learn she had published a cook book. Eagerly awaited and now in my hands, it is a triumph!

Clear, simple, and delicious recipes created with everyday ingredients. Beautiful photographs, sensible suggestions for substitutions, useful tips to ensure success, together with all the nutritional information so often missed in other books. The picture recipe index is a novel idea which comes in addition to a normal literary, alphabetical index.

Apart from the inspirational recipes, Carolyn explains how she came to embrace a low carb lifestyle, and applauds the health benefits that result. So helpful to those new to this way of eating and living, who may have heard all the usual negative comments about LC life. Helpful also to those who have already seen the light, and need back-up info when defending their choice!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Everything I wanted in a Keto Cookbook!
review: My new Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen cookbook has arrived. Carolyn Ketchum hit this out of the park! Not only is it filled with recipes that include photos and nutrition, it has lots of information on the keto diet, pantry and food lists, cooking utensils, tips & tricks for low carb baking, and lots more. Carolyn is the queen of low carb baking, in my opinion, but this cookbook also has plenty of other types of recipes. Here's a photo of the cover and table of contents. If you are a cookbook collector or are new to low carb eating, you will love this book. It would also make a great gift. I have toyed with the idea of publishing a low carb cookbook that include this much information, but Carolyn has already done it. Now all I need to do is recommend it to everyone I know. I just posted a recommendation for it to my Aunt Rocky's Low Carb Recipe Group on Facebook. And I can't wait to get in the kitchen and start cooking. Thank you, Carolyn!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Carolyn has hit a home run
review: I am an avid follower of Carolyn’s website “All Day I Dream About Food” and have made many of her recipes. I consider her to be the best when it comes to baking. Therefore, it was with much excitement that I pre-ordered last May when I first knew of her book. I decided that, for as many recipes as I had gotten “gratis” off her website, I genuinely wanted to support her first efforts of authorship. My book came last Friday and it was everything that I’d hoped it would be. By the end of the weekend I’d already whipped up a batch of butter pecan cookies. So good!!!! Her writings are are clear and concise, the photography is stunning and the selection of recipes are good. Well done, Carolyn!!!!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Best cookbook EVER!
review:
Remember when you used to buy a CD and you knew it was a good one because you could listen to the whole thing over and over and never skip a song?!? Well that’s the same for this cookbook - no one hit wonder, but each recipe is a top hit!!
From taco pie to cinnamon rolls to BBQ Sauce and taco seasoning to butter pecan cookies (which are amazingly delish), I am so excited to have this cookbook!
Thank you Carolyn for a family friendly Keto cookbook that offers variety without a crazy complicated list of ingredients! My entire family is loving the recipes without fail and I can’t be more thankful for that (with 4 kiddos 4 and under - this is a blessing)!
I have to say this is my favorite cookbook ever!!
~Holly

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: A Treasure Trove of Delicious Keto Recipes
review: As a follower of Carolyn's blog, I eagerly awaited the release of this cookbook, which does not disappoint. Packed with delicious keto recipes, it is also beautifully written and designed -- and the instructions are written with the author's trademark clarity and thoroughness. My husband and I are enjoying a "tour de cookbook" trying the various recipes, and we haven't found a loser yet. For those new to the LCHF way of eating, it also contains great info on meal planning, ingredients and substitutions. If you are interested in good food and good health, this is a worthwhile addition to your collection!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: My husband (not a diabetic) and I now get to have real breakfasts on the weekend like cream cheese waffles or coconut flour pancakes
review: Being a Type 1 Diabetic, I'm always looking for ways to eat "normal" food that doesn't put me on a blood sugar roller coaster. When I discovered Caroline's blog, I'd found my spot! When she released this cookbook, I bought it as soon as it came out. My husband (not a diabetic) and I now get to have real breakfasts on the weekend like cream cheese waffles or coconut flour pancakes, and for dinners I've made flatbread that tastes like actual flatbread, and CORN BREAD. Yes, CORN BREAD. And I can't say enough about the desserts. This cookbook also gives tips and substitutions for the real home cook, so if the batter looks a little weird, she explains why, and that it's normal, and it will rise just like any other! If you're trying to eat low carb for whatever reason, buy this cookbook!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: She is truly gifted in her ability to create all these recipes that so many of us love.. I have been following her from FB ...
review:
Carolyn Ketchum wears many hats in her kitchen..She is truly gifted in her ability to create all these recipes that so many of us love..
I have been following her from FB to her blog..she handles all those recipe questions in a gracious manner but doesn't book any BS either..
Quite simply she is the best...Looking forward to her other books that will come out next year..Give her a try, you won't be disappointed..

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Great Book
review: I do like the book and I think it does give some healthy and helpful tips. When your just starting this journey it nice to have help. So if you already know all the tips just skip that part and not complain about it. Most of the things I have chosen have been very good I have had a couple of fails but I don't think it was because of the recipe. The chocolate sauce is great and there is a roll recipe I use all the time, and they freeze pretty well. I use them for sandwiches and making garlic bread for zoodles. I also have the Easy Keto Dinners book and enjoy it also. I like her blog and she is very fast in responses to questions or substitutions. Give the book a try I'm sure you will find plenty that you love.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: I'm so glad I got impatient
review: I was trying to hold out and wait to get a copy for Christmas, but I couldn't do it! I'm so glad I got impatient, this is a wonderful cookbook for anyone on a keto diet. Beautiful pictures and delicious recipes, what more could you ask for? I've only made a couple of recipes so far, but they've been wonderful. I can't wait to cook my way through the rest of Carolyn's book. I highly recommend this book if you're already eating keto or if you're considering it, this cookbook will convince you that low carb doesn't have to be boring (plus you CAN eat dessert!).

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Best Cookbook I've Bought In A Very Long Time!!
review: This cookbook is the bomb!! The recipes are easy to follow and Carolyn gives all the details about where to find certain ingredients that you might not have in your kitchen. I have been following her blog for quite some time and I simply love this book. The photos are excellent and the book is really helpful for those just starting out as cooks AND in the keto lifestyle. I definitely recommend buying this book -- you won't regret it and your friends & family will love all the yummy recipes contained within!!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Buy It!
review: I hardly ever write reviews but I have to say please don't hesitate buying this book. The recipes are low carb and delicious. I am an African American woman who grew up in the south. We covet savory seasoned foods unfortunately the calories and carb that come with those foods will eventually catch up with you. I have made at least 4 recipes from this book and they have been AMAZING! They were also very simple to cook and less than an hour for most of them. These foods are like a little taste of heaven. The Chicken Cordon Blue Roll-Ups are to die for!!! I've also made Garlic Butter Steak Tips (Tasty), Savory Breakfast Cookies (so good have to make more), Crispy Buffalo Chicken (Yummy). Up next will be the Fish Saltimbocca. With this book you can eat fufilling foods and lose weight at the same time.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Easy to Follow, Ordinary recipes with some Uniqueness. Perfect for the non-expert cook!
review:
I'll just pile my five star review on top of the others. This is my third Keto cookbook and the only one that makes simplistic sense (the others don't cater to the person who really doesn't dig cooking, but would like to try a few new things and stay on Low Carb Track). I'm a busy chick (like the rest of the female population) and appreciate Carolyn's no-nonsense, easy-to-follow guidelines. About 80% [of the recipes] I can actually attempt without too much intimidation. And though I'll have to get a few things, my keto kitchen already has quite a few items she mentions.

I'm especially excited about the desserts that are difficult to make with non-traditional ingredients. I used to love to bake, but felt I had to give it up post-Keto woe, now, it looks like I don't! I have about 15#s to lose so I'm not about losing weight fast, but health and satisfaction of daily life because I feel better overall.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: You can't go wrong with these recipes- always delicious!!
review: You know what sets this book apart from others? Every single item us actually easy and delicious. There hasn't been a single recipe that I've tried from Carolyn Ketchum that was "meh". They are all "wow this is really tasty!". That is the win for me... Knowing I can trust any recipe and KNOW it's going to be great. With ingredients that can be much more expensive sometimes- you just don't want to gamble. This book here (and her blog alldayidreamaboutfood) is a sure thing. I can't wait to keep trying all there new recipes in here and look forward to the next books!!!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Love this cookbook!
review: I FINALLY got my cookbook today! It. Is. Gorgeous!! It is one of the most beautiful, well put together cookbook I've ever owned. Honestly, if you're on the fence about ordering it, it is worth every penny. My kids have been doing Keto with me since the summer. My 9 year old daughter, who has been giving me a hard time about eating Keto, is currently STUDYING the book as I type. Her eyes lighting up after every page. Thank you, Carolyn for this amazing book!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: So many fabulous recipes!
review: If you get this book you'll understand why it's consistently gotten 5 stars. I've made a ton of recipes and they've all been terrific! Her Super Simple Vanilla Ice Cream is the best keto ice cream recipe I've tried so far -- and I've done a number of them. It comes out very creamy. I serve it over her No-Bake Brownie Cheesecake Bars, which are also wonderful. You've also got to try the Almost-Instant Blender Chocolate Mousse. The Maple Bacon Pancake Muffins have become a staple in our house. So easy, just dump everything in a blender. Just made her Brie and Mushroom Quiche for dinner this week and have made her Low Carb BBQ Sauce many times. The Bacon, Spinach and Feta Frittata is also delicious. I have the Kindle edition and it works just fine. You'll really love this book.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Always a Great Keto Meal In Store.
review: I started following Carolyn when I first started my keto journey, seemed like every recipe I stumbled across on Facebook or Pinterest inevitably landed me at her blog. Long story short, I had to buy this knowing that it would be awesome, because I can't think of a single instance where I didn't make one of Carolyn's recipes and it wasn't absolutely incredible. My wife and I are definitely "variety is the spice of life" type people, and being such that is usually what causes us to derail on our food plans or lifestyle changes. Carolyn, her books, her blog, and her overall Internet presence make it easy to follow, and stay on the keto way of life. Couldn't have done it without her amazing recipes.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Must buy cookbook for every low carber!
review: This book is a great starter for those new to the keto low carb lifestyle. The information provided gives you everything you need to know. The best part is every one of Carolyn’s recipes have always been a success when I made them. This is important as the ingredients used can be more expensive then normal ingredients. I have shared several recipes I have made with my coworkers and they had no idea that they were low carb or healthy for them and were shocked when I told them.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: The BEST of the BEST in Low Carb-High Fat
review: You NEED this cookbook! It is the BEST of the BEST. Carolyn has managed to save me time and money with these NO FAIL recipes. They are simple, easy, made with things around my home. (I already ate Low Carb-High Fat) I am loving the healthier me everyday. All of the swaps and tips are amazing, and really people,,,,,the recipes taste AMAZING! You wont miss anything white!!!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Brownie. Cheesecake. Bars.
review: My 13 year old son decided to trial low carb eating at the encouragement of a Type 1 friend. We ordered this book, some almond flour and some swerve, and now we have tasty low-carb treats each week. The book itself is beautiful, and the recipes come out perfect every time. My son now bakes things from this book weekly for my very busy friend who was recently diagnosed with diabetes. I’m so thankful for this beautiful introduction to low carb eating.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: It’s a Keto diet game changer!
review: I’m a collector of cookbooks, I have hundreds of them. This book is incredibly well written and ALL of the recipes are actually something I would consider making. It also has full color pictures of every recipe, a definite plus! The ingredients are minimal with very easy instructions to follow. Carolyn has made the Keto diet more than do-able. She’s made it exciting and delicious! My whole outlook has changed about being able to follow a Keto diet without sacrificing the pleasures that come from eating a “normal” diet.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: A must have for those doing keto
review: I remember first looking through the book and thinking, "wait, are we sure this is keto?" because all of the food looked amazing. She includes calories and macros for each thing, which i feel is kind of required. The first chapter is probably the best one, just because it's all of the basic stuff we keto-ers thought we could never eat again. The magic mozzarella dough is really good and super versatile. The teriyaki sauce is the best homemade teriyaki sauce ive ever made, and that includes high carb ones. The Taco Pie is the best thing you will ever eat! And the desserts, omg the desserts. They are really freaking easy to make and tastes phenomenal. I utilize this book all the time and it's the first one I pick up when looking for something to fill that sweet tooth craving. Everything is really easy and doesnt include a million ingredients and steps like a few other keto cook books I have. It's kind of like Keto cooking for dummies. I recommend this book to everyone who is just starting out. I cant wait to see what other books she come out with!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Perfect Combination of Helpful and Delicious
review: What a treat to have this delightful cookbook delivered to my door. Every recipe that Carolyn Ketchum creates is yummy and I have not been disappointed by this collection. additionally, she has inclluded a lot of tips and guidance for the Keto and Low Carb life style. You can't go wrong. Highly recomment

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: This book is beyond excellent. I knew it would be good as I ...
review:
This book is beyond excellent. I knew it would be good as I have followed Carolyn online for quite some time. My expectations were greatly exceeded. The pictures are phenomenal and the instructions are concise, easy, clear, and simple to follow.

My son has type one diabetes and it MADE HIS DAY receiving a cookbook in the mail full of amazing recipes that wouldn't kill his blood sugar.

Hands down, Carolyn is my favorite author of recipes that I use to cook for my family. You won't go wrong ordering this book.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: One of the best!
review: I have been doing the ketogenic diet for nearly 11 months, and I have had great success. I have bought several cookbooks that suit this way of eating, but The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen is definitely one of my favorites. I have followed Carolyn's blog for a while, and I have yet to find a recipe of hers that disappoints me. They are all SO good! I have already bought additional copies of this book to give out to friends and family for Christmas. If you are considering buying this book, stop thinking about it and just do it! You won't be sorry!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: The author gave a lot of very good information about ketogenesis in addition to delicious recipes
review: I am fairly new to the kerogenic way of eating. I found this very helpful. The author gave a lot of very good information about ketogenesis in addition to delicious recipes! My husband loves the items that I have cooked from this book! I highly recommend it! Can't wait for her next book!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: I have made many of the recipes and they never disappoint. I am a type 1 diabetic and I ...
review: This cookbook is a must for people following a low carb lifestyle. I have made many of the recipes and they never disappoint. I am a type 1 diabetic and I can say two things for certain about the recipes in the book : 1. They are delicious and 2. I never have to deal with a spike in blood sugar.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Amazing Keto cookbook
review: Great introduction explaining low carb, high fat lifestyle. Author explains a lot and I’ve already been doing it for two months. She filled in a lot holes. Great recipes and every recipe has a photo! Bonus points for that! I have made a few of these recipes from her blog and they are delicious.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: and everyone has turned out beautifully. I asdo love the format of the book
review: I have tried several recipes already, and everyone has turned out beautifully. I asdo love the format of the book. Each recipe is complimented by a large color photo, nutritional info and helpful tips. My favorite part of the book is the recipe index which shows the page number and a small color photo of every recipe by category, so I can quickly find the one I'm looking for. Includes plenty of recipes for the holidays, too!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Bought all her books!
review: Best recipes, simple, beautiful pics as well. I would follow her blog from All Day I Dream About Food and I’m so happy she wrote her books. I have her dessert, breakfast, and dinners also! My kids love all that I’ve made and I’m a forever fan!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Best keto cookbook out there
review:
I love this book! It has so many good and easy recipes!! I loved it so much that I bought my friend one for her birthday! Carolyn goes above and beyond in her books, explaining things and giving useful tips. The colorful pictures for every recipe are amazing! I am
such a visual person. Thank you for such wonderful recipes!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: This is the best low carb book I have ever seen!
review: I am so excited to try some of the new recipes in here! I have been cooking low carb for about 10 years and have found recipes from other people to work sometimes. I have Never had any of Carolyn's fail! That is saying a lot. If you only buy 1 cookbook this is the one to buy!!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Great cookbook! This includes recipes for many popular dishes
review: Great cookbook! This includes recipes for many popular dishes, but made in a keto way of eating. No crazy ingredients - just real, whole foods. Lots of great pictures and good information about the beginning of the book about what keto is, how it works, etc. I like Carolyn Ketchum's recipes. This is a good buy.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: There is a nice variety of recipes
review: This cookbook is fabulous. There is a nice variety of recipes, and none of them have hard to find ingredients and most are under 30 min, including prep time. I live in a small town and I am able to find the ingredients needed. The sweet treats in this cookbook have helped me stay on track as that has always been a struggle for me. The tips the author gives are a great bonus.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Tried and true recipes
review: Love this lady's recipes and I love this book! She has some of the best low carb/keto recipes I've ever tried. The butter pecan cookies are so delicious and simple to make. The coconut oil brownies are decadent and oh so chocolatey. I did try the sweet recipes first, lol, but her bread is really good and one of the better keto breads I've tried. I trust her recipes to be really low carb as she's a type 1 diabetic. She provides the macros. I always do my own anyway because I use different products than the ones she uses sometimes. She has the dry ingredients measured in cups AND grams. I love this! I measure everything in grams. It makes it so easy to get the recipes right each and every time. I bought the kindle version of this book because I don't have bookshelf space. It's easy to navigate the recipes on the kindle version.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Best food blogger EVER!
review: My favorite new recipe person FINALLY wrote a book. This one is highly recommended by me. Great recipes. I have NEVER seen a bad one. Rest assured you are the getting the very best! I have known her for years and all her stuff is top-notch. Yeah!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Great variety of recipes
review: Great variety of recipes and love that she describes ingredients in front of book. I don't have the money or space to include every possible keto friendly ingredient in my pantry, but I do have a basic understanding of what I need on hand to create delicious dishes.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Dont miss this one.
review: Carolyn’s recipes are focused on health and taste. She has her children as her test judges! The recipes are super easy and often don't require fancy kitchen equipment. I have depended on her wonderful blog for years and feel proud to have done so before the keto craze took off. Once you meet her, even via Facebook, you will see why people love her.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Best keto cookbook ever!
review: I made the crab cakes to the recipe and they are the best crab cakes I've ever made!! Love this book! The only criticism I'd give is it gives the nutritional value but not the serving size for all the dishes.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Keto centric, but great recipes for anyone cutting sugar!
review: This book is an extension of a great low carb website that is also chock full of recipes. The ones here though are tested through and through until perfection is reached. If you're on keto looking to still be able to bake, or a diabetic who needs to find a way to control their glucose levels, or just low carb and needing some more variety than meat and cheese, look no further than The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen. (Well, feel free to look further, but this should seriously be one of your first purchases.)

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: LOVE this cookbook
review: This cookbook has the most luscious recipes. It is well written and beautiful photos.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Amazing!
review:
I am so glad I ordered this book! I have been following Carolyn Ketchum'so blog, "all day I dream about food," for a few years now. So when I heard the news of a cookbook I was thrilled.

This is more than just a cookbook. The details, the pictures, the substitutions are just unbelievable! This is not a book that was just thrown together. If you're low carb or even interested in low carb recipes, you will not be disappointed!! Seriously, just amazing! I'm blown away by the quality and the price.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Absolute Necessity for my Keto journey
review: Absolute must have for the new keto dieter! This is my “go to” keto cookbook. I have never made anything I didn’t like from this book. When starting out several months ago the Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen gave me so many valuable tips and information on how to proceed. I found the book, then Carolyn’s blog and newsletter. Now I’m looking forward to her dessert cookbook!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Love this Keto cookbook
review: Love this Keto cookbook! Have learned so much on how to make yummy ketogenic dishes from Carolyn. They are simple recipes for a busy life and nice photography of what you are making. Love her dessert recipes!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Five Stars
review: Many options for a keto eater.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Wow
review: Amazing photos and easy to read format. I can hardly wait to make more than a few of these recipes. Thank you

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Amazing Cookbook
review: Carolyn is my favorite low-carb blogger, and I have been making her recipes for years. So I didn't hesitate to pre-order her 1st cookbook. It is a masterpiece of wonderful recipes and gorgeous photos, along with useful tips and resources. I highly recommend this book for anyone trying to maintain a healthy low-carb and/or ketogenic lifestyle!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Easy, yummy keto!
review: We love this cookbook and can’t wait for her next release in March. Great work Carolyn!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Made it easy to start our new way of eating.
review: This is a great book for anyone starting a ketogenic diet. There is valuable information on how different products work with the recipes and why she choose the ones she uses. I have made several of them since I got the book a few days ago and my husband I both love them all. Very very happy with everything about the book.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: The must-have keto book!
review: I use this weekly! I have so many keto recipes and books, but always return to this one. So many great, easy, and delicious recipes. Makes you forget you’re eating keto!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Get yours today!
review: This is our first keto cookbook. We absolutely love it! Recipes are easy and delicious. My wife follows Carolyn on Facebook and is in her Facebook group.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Not only is it full of amazing recipes, it breaks down eating Keto
review: This book is everything you need to know about how to live life on the Ketogenic diet and be successful. Not only is it full of amazing recipes, it breaks down eating Keto, foods you should and shouldn't eat, and so much more!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Best Low Carb recipes
review: Carolyn's recipes are simply the best! I love this cookbook. She has a gift for low carb recipes that taste so good. You'll not be sorry if you buy this cookbook. Delicious food!!!!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: In love with
review: Just a day or two rambling through this cookbook has been a refreshing taste of how simply put information can make you feel like an Einstein! Nothing is left unanswered and recipes make you want to start whipping up things instantly,,,buy it,,,and a pleasure to behold too

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Great recipes; includes pictures of each recipe
review: Great cookbook. There is a picture of every recipe including nutritional values. Straight-forward instructions and tips that result in wonderful recipes. I am a cookbook collector and this one is definitely top notch! Well done, Carolyn Ketchum. Please write many more.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
