title: Get this book!
review: This book is awesome! The recipes are delicious. Carolyn's recipes are the reason I feel that a keto diet is sustainable long term. If you are looking for low carb recipes that actually do taste GREAT, this is the book for you. Easy to follow directions, simple recipes, beautiful pictures. YUM!!!!!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: So glad I found this book
review: I got my book a couple months ago! I have made several of the recipes in it and have loved every one so far! New Mexico style smother pork chops... YUM! The recipes are simple and very satisfying! So glad I found this book!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: This is a great cookbook for anyone trying to eat low carb or ...
review: This is a great cookbook for anyone trying to eat low carb or keto. I've started with the basics: sheet pan chicken, cauliflower, pizza and duck fat cookies and I am looking forward to working my way through all the recipes. The book is full of pictures and has helpful tips. I highly recommend it!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Best Keto cookbook
review: Really great cookbook by my favorite food blogger. Fail proof delicious recipes, and easy!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Great Beginning
review: Great cookbook for introducing Ketogenic eating. I have many place markers for the recipes I will make again. I have learned about the process and many products new to me.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Awesome keto cookbook!
review: I have over a dozen cookbooks for eating ketogenic and this one is by far the best. I may not even look at the others again.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: I love how these recipes are so delicious
review: I love how these recipes are so delicious! Low Carb is really the way to live but I don't have any ideas on my own outside of a piece of meat and a salad/veggie! Great book and info on how to get started.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Carolyn's book is full of good recipes, easy to prepare and are delicious
review: One of the hardest parts of Keto is finding those "comfort foods" that we have become so attached to in our previous way of eating. Carolyn's book is full of good recipes, easy to prepare and are delicious! I follow her blog and she, along with Kristi Sullivan, are my two go-to people in cooking.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: SIMPLY THE BEST!
review: Carolyn is brilliant. She understands that adopting keto must be easy and delicious. Truly the only book we go to now. All her books are great and love her website; All Day I Dream About Food.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: many recipes that I would enjoy making.
review: Haven't made anything yet because I'm waiting for my kitchen to be remodeled but the food in the book looked delicious...many recipes that I would enjoy making.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: This is a terrific Keto Low Carb Cookbook
review:
This is a terrific Keto Low Carb Cookbook!!!
I just got my book a couple of days ago. Carolyn explains Keto in an understanding way and her recipes are wonderful as usual. Well worth the price. Thanks Carolyn.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: A lot of info for the KETO lifestyle!
review: One of the best well written cookbooks for the KETO diet! The ideas and suggestions from the author for getting started I found most helpful. The information found in this cookbook is such a bonus in addition to the recipes which are awesome & easy to follow!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Best cookbook ever!!
review: Love this book!! Best cookbook I’ve ever purchased. Great recipes with pictures and instructions. Recipes are healthy and included nutional information also.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Great book
review: Great book. Love the recipes. Easy to follow. Good advice. Best pizza dough recipe I’ve had.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: This is the best organized cookbook I’ve ever seen and I love all ...
review: This is the best organized cookbook I’ve ever seen and I love all the pictures and advice. I’ve yet to use one of Carolyn Ketchum’s recipes and have it miss the mark - there are so many in this book that I want to try. Great resource for my low carb lifestyle!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: This book is AMAZING-I have been having a great time cooking Low Carb with these recipes
review: This book is AMAZING-I have been having a great time cooking Low Carb with these recipes!!!!! The "everything crackers & the short ribs-just to name a few were EXCELLENT!!!!!!!!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Love it
review: Great variety of recipes. Easy to follow. I did purchase the other 2 that this author wrote as well! Great!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Excellent resource
review: Beautiful illustrations and directions for the Keto chef.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Easy accessable recipes
review: What a beautiful cookbook! Every recipe has a photo, techniques are explained, many tips to help you be successful. Anyone not on a Keto diet would wish they were after seeing these recipes.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Good book
review: This is a good book that doesn't go overwhelmingly into keto but just enough and has a ton of reciepes.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Highly Recommended
review: I love this book. Starting out with a Keto diet, the fear is not knowing what to cook. With this, and Carolyn's weekly blog, I actually try out new things. I just recommended it this week to my best friend, who is interested in the diet now.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Amazing cookbook
review: I think this is a very informative cookbook. I've followed Carolyns since she started sharing her wonderful gift of developing recipes. A wonderful cookbook for anybody who wants to learn about low carb. The recipes are easy to follow and it always comes out . Great cookbook .

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Five Stars
review: I don't think you can go wrong with any of Carolyn's books. Every recipe I've made has been delicious.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Check on Amazon for prices! It was a good price love shopping on Amazon!
review: Love the cookbook a lot of good recipes to make.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)

review: Pretty Pictures, Yummy Recipes, and a fun mix of additional recipes - I usually ONLY follow Maria Emmerich, but Carolyn... I'm giving you a chance, too... ;)

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Wonderful!
review: This is an amazing cookbook. I bought mine several months ago and I have still not tried all the recipes. But, of the ones I have tried, everyone was delicious!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: All new recipes and the best low carb cookie recipe i have ever made (butter ...
review: Carolyn’s blog is a treasure trove of recipes for people who are eating low carb, and this book is the same! All new recipes and the best low carb cookie recipe i have ever made (butter pecan cookies!). Her recipes always work and are delicious! I bought one for myself and for a friend. Totally worth the purchase!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: this cookbook has it all
review: I like beautiful cookbooks with great pictures, and of course magnificent recipes. This book has it all. The recipes are well constructed and have been obviously tried and tested. There is a nice variety of meals for all tastes. I love it.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: The pictures are nice and the recipes have weights along with volume measurements ...
review: The pictures are nice and the recipes have weights along with volume measurements for some of the ingredients. It's very useful and well organized.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Get started on a healthy new you
review: The perfect cook book for anyone starting out on a Keto diet, well it is more than a diet. It is a life style change. Great pictures easy directions.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: I love this cook book
review: I love this cook book. I have made several of the recipes. They were easy to follow and turned out great. It also has beautiful picture.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Five Stars
review: Carolyn has outdone herself with some amazing Keto recipes. This cook book is awesome! So glad I bought it!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Love everything in this book!
review: Very rarely do I buy a cook book and want to try almost everything in it. The recipes are easy and so far everything I have made turns out delicious! Highly recommend this book. I will definitely make anything she does! Makes low carb/keto living easy!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Fantastic recipe book
review: Love the recipe book and all the hints and recipes in it. Have tagged almost every page. My husband is even looking through it. Thank you for writing this and for all the research and sharing.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Low carb with FLAVOR
review: For anyone following a low-carb ketogenic diet and lifestyle, this book is a must-have. The recipes are beautiful, easy and look absolutely delicious. Can't wait to put some of these in my regular rotation.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Yum!!
review: Carolyn’s recipes are practical and delicious! I plan on using this book on a regular basis! I certainly hope she comes out with more books....as I will definitely buy them!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Recipes are easy to follow
review: Must have book for anyone following a keto/low carb way of eating! Recipes are easy to follow, with limited ingredient lists, and the pictures and tips are GREAT! Thank you for making low carb life more enjoyable and flavorful Carolyn!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Love this book ...
review: ... but the very best thing in it is the Lemon Poppyseed Quick Bread which is to die for.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: If you keto, you need-o!
review: I appreciate this book to help get me out of the typical protein and veggie boredom that keto can be. Bon appetite!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Extraordinary
review: What I love about Carolyn’s recipes are that they are reliable. I never have to worry that I need to complete a test recipe. I know whatever I make from her cookbook or blog will be extraordinary and I’m never disappointed.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Keto easy to follow
review: Love this book recipes are easy to follow and taste great. Gives the best information on keto.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Best Low Carb Cookbook on the Market
review: I have followed Carolyn for quite some time and love her recipes. They are amazing and just what I need as a diabetic. I am looking forward to making more of these recipes over the Christmas holiday!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: This cookbook is the best Keto guide I have
review: This cookbook is the best Keto guide I have. The recipes are easy and delicious. Carolyn is awesome and really takes the time to put things together well and in a easy format. Every recipe has a photo. Buy now!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: This is by far my favorite Keto cookbook
review: This is by far my favorite Keto cookbook! If your sweet tooth is undeniable, as mine definitely is, you will never go wrong making one of Carolyn’s recipes. My non-Keto family loves them, too!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Great keto help
review: Easy to follow keto recipes. Nice photography. Will be trying many of these recipes.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Plain Good Ole Food Cookbook
review: I do suggest you get this cookbook! Every recipe that I have tried has been outstanding! I look forward to trying the recipes in all categories!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Best Keto Book for Beginners!!!!
review: I just received this today. I normally do not read a cookbook from front cover to back cover. However, this one, was made with such quality and the visuals were so pleasing to my eyes! I decided to give it a try! From the forward page to the index - very well written! I really feel like I will be using this daily - just like my Bible. I highly recommend this book if you are trying Keto for the first time. The recipes look delicious. I definitely am going to start using these recipes starting later tonight! I have seen her blog and some of her recipes online and I have tried a couple. I love how precise she is because that makes the recipes fail safe! It’s a big book & plenty of recipes & plenty of tips & great ideas! I bought a couple of things off Amazon to prepare me for the new recipes. I can’t say how much I recommend this book! Best money I’ve spent so far on this new lifestyle of mine!

title: Too much dairy!
review: This is a beautiful cookbook but way too many of the recipes use dairy with only occasional offerings of substitutions. In addition, dairy is an inflammatory food and for anyone focusing on a health who uses dairy as a protein, especially as much as this author suggests, diminishes many of the other healthy aspects of a keto diet.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Fabulous
review: I received this cookbook as a gift and it is already my new favorite. I am an avid follower of Carolyn Ketchum's blog and had high hopes for her first cookbook. It did not disappoint. I have been eating keto for just over a year. I started in order to lose 15 pounds that had creeped up. I continue because I feel so much better eating low-carb, low-sugar, and gluten-free. The cookbook has wonderful sections on a ketogenic diet, ketogenic ingredients, and tips for successful ketogenic baking. Then it dives into some seriously delicious recipes. Don't be fooled by the simplicity. Every thing I've made so far has been easy and delicious. My family's favorites so far are Easy Taco Pie, Roasted Cabbage Wedges with Blue Cheese and Bacon, Spicy Shrimp and Cucumber Noodles, Cheesy Cauliflower Grits, and No-Bake Haystack Cookies. And there are many more recipes I can't wait to try. I have no hesitation recommending this cookbook whether you are new to the ketogenic way of eating or an old-hand at it. Carolyn Ketchum is a magician in the keto kitchen and even her most simple recipes result in a satisfying tasty meal that the whole family will enjoy - including those who don't adhere to a low-carb way of eating.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: One of the best cookbooks I've ever seen!
review: I am getting ready to start a keto diet in January, and this way of eating is totally new to me. So I decided to get this book to help me figure it out. I am so glad I did! I own too many cookbooks to count, but this is one of the best. I read it cover to cover, and was totally impressed with the quality of the editing (I didn't see one typo!); how great the recipes are (There is literally not one I don't think I'd like); and the quality and beauty of the book. Although it is a paperback (no I didn't get the Kindle edition that the review shows), it uses the highest quality paper (It actually weighs over 2.5 lbs!), and every recipe has a beautiful color photo. It is laid out for easy cooking (no recipes spanning to a different page -- I hate that). There is even an index section that has color photos of each item (I've never seen that before). I also appreciated the introductory part that explains differences in various products and recommends some brand named ones, and even what kitchen equipment would be helpful (but not necessary). I was a little apprehensive to start this way of living, but now I think it will be totally doable and tasty. It even lists various keto resources that will be helpful. I can't recommend this book highly enough! I was totally impressed!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Not just another
review:
I have been following Carolyn's blog, All Day I Dream about Food, for a few years now, so I'm no stranger to her delicious recipes and beautiful photography. Of course, I needed to check out her new cookbook.

When I received this cookbook, I was blown away by how thorough the cookbook is. Not only does it contain loads of recipes, but there is also a section discussing keto ingredients, one discussing equipment to make keto cooking easier, and even a seven day sample diet. If you're new to eating keto or low-carb, or can only buy one cookbook, this is the one for you!

The book contains loads of recipes for breakfast, lunch, dinner, beverages, and snacks. There is a large section with breads, muffins, and scones, which are foods that are frequently missed by those on a keto diet. Carolyn has us covered!

Carolyn has made her cookbook a work of art. She uses the same white on white style of photography that she uses in her blog. I enjoy paging through it just to look at the pictures.

In short, I love this book and highly recommend it to those eating low-carb or ketogenic diets.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: The Best Cookbook I Have Ever Bought
review:
WOW...where do I begin. I was looking for a diabetic cookbook or something that was semi sugar free and low carbs. I was disappointed in the Diabetic cookbook reviews whereas a lot of reviewers complained of high carbs and issues with the recipes. I would think if it was an excellent diabetic cookbook it would adhere closely to true recipes in controlling blood sugars but too many reviews didn't indicate that. Confused again!
In one review tho, Carolyn Ketchums name was mentioned and the review was intriguing. I found the cookbook on Amazon and was impressed by the 5 stars with 500+ reviews and thought it must be really good or Carolyn has a lot of friends. This is where the WOW comes in. I purchased it realizing it was Ketogenic which I had sort of tried before but finding good recipes and understanding actually how to go forward and not knowing what products should I buy turned me off. The information really wasn't there.
In comes Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen. Unbelievably informative. I have never, ever seen a cookbook that literally answers all your questions as you are reading the recipes. She tells you what brand you can buy, and where to buy it. Explains the difference in one oil or the other and why not to substitute Almond flour for Coconut flour. It is better to buy Cacao Butter chips and not a block. The information on sweeteners and which to choose from was a great help. There is so much good information that I have already cleaned out my pantry and have ordered new ingredients. I have never heard of a mozzarella crust for pizza or bread sticks. Recipes for crackers & chips that I will actually be able to make & eat without feeling guilty. The food recipes appear to be very easy to make and look delicious and definitely looking forward to trying them all. This seriously feels like a food bible to me. It has not gone unnoticed that an incredible amount of research and work went into putting this cookbook together. She obviously gave a considerable amount of time thinking what a newbie or seasoned reader would need to use the recipes in her book.
Thank you Carolyn for having the insight to put together a cookbook that is truly fantastic. I also found her blog and I am now a follower. The next best thing will be the Dessert Cookbook coming out in July which I will certainly pre-order! FIVE STARS all the way..

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: I am a little disappointed in this book simply because this author's recipes are ...
review: I am a little disappointed in this book simply because this author's recipes are amazing, and most of the recipes included in the book really are not. I'm getting weary of keto authors going through the basics of ingredients and needed cookware. Wasted space in a cookbook, in my opinion. We know what gadgets to use. Just give us the recipes. There are also not as many recipes in this book as other popular keto cookbooks. Some of the recipes included are extremely basic, Google-type recipes, and are not really not cookbook-worthy. (Pico De Gallo?) The recipes she has on her website and blog posts are better than what were included in this book. This author is capable of so much more, so I was surprised that this book was so basic.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Best diabetic/keto friendly recipes available
review:
My daughter has Type one diabetes. I have been cooking Carolyn Ketchum's recipes off of her blog ( All day long I dream about food) for almost 4 years now. The book is great because my daughter loves looking through the colorful book and choosing anything she wants which is huge!!!! The recipe's are not only healthy but to hear my daughter squeek "Yummy" makes my mommy heart happy.

I learned a long time ago just because a recipe is on the Internet doesn't mean it's a good one. I have learned to trust Carolyn's recipe's. They are easy to follow, healthy, and always make me look like a great cook.

Some of the things that really stand out in the book are the big bright pages. I love the font size so I don't have to worry about leaning in while I'm cooking. Also she has included a wealth of information on keto-friendly ingredients, low carb sweeteners, swaps and substitutions, huge resource section, and a ton of stuff that took me years or trial and error to learn. There was even some things I didn't know!!!!

Definitely a keeper!!! I'm super happy with my purchase and I can't thank this lady enough. I cried when I read the bit about her not changing a thing. Music to this moma's ears.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: You must get this cookbook!!!❤️❤️❤️
review:
I've been waiting for the talented food blogger Carolyn Ketchum to put her amazing Keto recipes into a book and it is finally here! Do not miss out! These recipes are not only delicious, they are also family friendly! I made the BBQ pulled pork and my kids are still asking me to make it again!

Watch out Betty Crocker! Carolyn is my new go to recipe girl!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: User friendly for new keto cooks and well written
review:
Excellent cookbook for all and great keto introduction for newbies. The recipes use ingredients readily available at Walmart or most grocery stores. They're clearly written, the tips for substitutions or meal pairings are great, and there aren't 500 weird ingredients needed for every single recipe. I've bought other low carb or keto cookbooks and while I have enjoyed them, they were full of grammatical errors, layout mistakes, and poor editing. Not the case here. Carolyn knows her stuff regarding keto cooking and concise, accurate communication!

Definitely check out her internet and social media accounts too, you'll find amazing recipes and wonderful support from her and her fans.

This cookbook is a gamechanger for anyone who needs a good foundation to start a keto/low carb diet. It's life changing.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Skeptic turned believer - so much low-carb baking goodness and family-pleasing recipes!
review:
This is the best cookbook I have ever had in two ways: 1) the great majority of its recipes are things I'm interested in making and not too complicated for my level of skill and patience, and 2) everything I've made from it so far (and that's a good two dozen recipes) has been great, with just one exception (but my husband did that one, and he's not always the best follower of directions, and it still tasted great, just off on the texture).

I was skeptical about many of the recipes -- light focaccia? Sunflower bread that would really work for toast and sandwiches? New York style cheesecake? I started with the ones that seemed the most credible, and as success mounted on success, I bought some of the more exotic ingredients for the ones I couldn't believe would work. I truly haven't been disappointed yet. Last night I made the pork chops smothered with green chile, and to my surprise even my super-picky-eater son ate as much as he could hold (he cut the spice a bit with sour cream). I'm a believer now.

I will say, read the author's recommendations on ingredients. Zucchini scones made with frozen squash and coarse almond meal instead of fresh/fine ground? Not so special, though still quite tasty! But focaccia made with the recommended super-fine almond meal and unflavored whey protein powder? Really, really nice.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: An absolute if you are Keto! I recommend this cookbook to all my friends.
review:
I absolutely adore & appreciate this book. The recipes are easy to make & follow. This is the first cookbook that I have used tons of recipes out of. The Butter Pecan Cookies everyone loves! I use this cookbook for my non-Keto family and they love the recipes! I just saw that Carolyn has a breakfast cookbook. Woot, Woot! I even bought an ice cream maker to go with this cookbook. Smile!

I just ordered two more books for my friends! Try the Taco Pie recipe. You make your own spice. This is so delish it’s now our go to!!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Good, tasty recipes! Highly recommend, especially for newbie Keto folks like us!
review:
My family really enjoys all the recipes we've tried so far from this book--and we've tried 23 of them thus far. Recipes are simple & easy--some are pretty basic, as other reviewers have said--but it makes for easy execution! We are v e r y new to this Keto way, & these recipes make it easy to adopt this new way of shopping/cooking, and that makes a difference when you're trying to change the way you eat & think about food. The eating is fun, too, because things are so tasty! (And, I think that has helped a lot because it's been rather easy for the family to embrace this way of eating.) All the dishes we've brought to gatherings, which, so far, have been main dish/appetizer-types, have gotten rave reviews, too.

The many "bread" recipes make this cookbook different from other Keto cookbooks we have, & we like that. The Hamburger Buns fluff up nicely, are sturdy, and have nice flavor. The Apple Cider Donut Bites definitely taste better the next day as the flavors seem to meld better (but we didn't have any trouble sampling quite a few the same day they were made!). We also really like the Magic Mozzarella Dough. Oh, and the Coconut Oil Brownies--we're so glad we didn't have to wait for them to come to room temperature after refrigerating them :)

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Good Variety of Recipes!
review: This is a good cookbook that does include nutritional info on each of the recipes included in the book, which is helpful. The lack thereof in Dr. Mercola's book, Fat for Fuel, is one of its major complaints from readers. I have both books and find them to complement each other in that, between the two of them, there are more than enough varied recipes to keep one happy! Highly recommend readers having both in their arsenal.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: This cookbook has changed my life & brought joy to my T1 diabetic husband
review: This cookbook has changed my life & brought joy to my T1 diabetic husband, struggling with low carb eating. The desserts alone are worth the purchase. Hints, swaps, information on low carb/KETO, priceless. I've had more recipe successes in 4 months with this book, than in 50 years of dismal cooking.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Keto/low carb and delicious recipes made easy for everyone!
review:
Have loved every recipe we've tried so far! Easy to follow directions, great information about ingredient substitution and items needed to stock a keto/low carb pantry! Also, love the tips given below the recipe for a little extra helpful hints and tricks. Plus, there is nutrition information given at bottom of page. If you follow exactly, then, you don't even have to do your own calculations!
Bonus: Carolyn Ketchum has a website and Facebook page for even MORE information, and she often personally responds to posts!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Delicious! Easy to make! Great Information!
review: I started the Keto woe several months ago and used many recipes from various blogs. After some time, I realized that most of them were Carolyn’s. Her style of writing and knack for creating delicious and easy to prepare meals makes following Keto so easy. I find myself meal planning and enjoying my kitchen like I never had before. Her book contains useful information beyond the recipes that further educated me on why a Keto life is the right life for me and my husband.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Easy and family friendly recipes
review: This book has really great recipes that are easy and appealing to the entire family... I’ve had this book for a while and finally made the lasagna stuffed bell peppers recipe. The preparation was super easy, as well as the clean up. My kids loved it and asked for seconds. After dinner, my eldest flipped through the book and asked can he pick the next recipe to try 😂. I can’t wait to try more of these delicious looking dishes!!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: I love to cook and this book really opened new possibilities ...
review: I have been on keto for about a year and a half. I love to cook and this book really opened new possibilities for cooking keto. A lot of the other cookbooks I have purchased were for someone who really didn't have an imagination about cooking keto or for someone who didn't really know how to cook. I have always added my own to recipes and this gave me great new ideas, as well as wonderful recipes to follow. Can't wait for the keto dessert book. Thank You Carolyn Ketchum!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Hands down the best Keto recipies around
review: My friend Kristin inspired me to take a chance on this book and I am beyond grateful that I took her advice. This cookbook has changed the Ketogenic game! The recipes are TO DIE FOR. I don’t even miss the sugar and carbohydrates. This book is life changing and a must have.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Literally everday cooking
review: Amazing, literally everyday cooking. Even my Foreign Exchange student loves the recipes. Our absolute all time favorite is the sheet pan chicken with bacon & Brussels sprouts! Practically a weekly meal in our home now! Just bought her new book & can't wait to try it!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: More than a cookbook!
review: This book is more than just a cookbook, it is a guide to change your health. I really appreciated the picture index in the back as well. I hope the author will write more cookbooks!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Life changing cookbook!
review: I love this book so much. Carolyn’s recipes have made sticking with Keto not only possible but fun. Her waffles are life changing. I use this cookbook weekly. I’m not sure I’d feel as confident embracing keto as a permanent way of life without her recipes and her passion for keto as an avenue for long term health. When I started keto I mourned the loss of baking for me and my family. She has given desserts back!!! She truly is a low carb baking genius!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Easy, delicious, practical
review: I got this for Christmas, I've tried 3 recipes so far and YUM! The Easy Taco Pie is perfect. The Coconut Oil Brownies satisfy the chocolate craving. My favorite so far is the Crock Pot Broccoli Cheddar Soup. It's sooooooo good!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Delicious!
review: I received this cookbook as a gift. I've tried a bunch of recipes since Thanksgiving and every single recipe is a hit.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: These recipes have to be some of the best Ketogenic recipes available
review: These recipes have to be some of the best Ketogenic recipes available, everyone I have tried has been excellent. Highly recommended.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)

review: Every recipe so far has been great. Easy to follow recipes and consistent results. Lots of easy recipes for weeknight meals. One of my favorite low carb/keto cookbooks.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)

review: I have followed Carolyn's blog website for a while, and when I seen this book, I just had to have it! Lots of creative recipes for Keto followers. I'm very glad I purchased it.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Serious Deliciousness!!!
review: I have thought of Carolyn for a long time as the Queen of Low Carb desserts, but her cookbook kicks things up to a whole new level. This girl has skills in the kitchen. The recipes aren't complicated, are delicious and I seriously want to make EVERYTHING in the book!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: are easy to follow
review: The recipes in this book, are easy to follow, and taste delicious. Carolyn allows us to eat some of the foods you may be missing in a keto lifestyle. I know many do this for weightloss, but for me it is a forever way of eating because of health issues. Love having recipes I can go to, that don't take forever to prepare.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Good info in front of book if you are new ...
review:
I actually bought this for diabetes. Everything is low carb and sugar free!
Good info in front of book if you are new to cooking with almond flour etc.
Easy and yummy.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)

review: I've liked every recipe I've tried. Many are quick, and the baked items don't taste like eggs.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!
review: I have been making her recipes for a while. They always turn out and the recipes are spot on. With this cookbook there is a picture for every recipe which I love the layout is nice just a great selection of recipes.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Best KETO cookbook by far
review: Been making my way through this cookbook and love it. It has made it so much less painful for me to give up sugar/starch. My husband is a chef and he has been impressed with the recipes & food. I also like her no nonsense voice & point of view.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: I absolutely LOVE this cookbook
review: I absolutely LOVE this cookbook. It has been a game changer for me in low carb eating. If I am looking for something yummy to bake or eat I know I can choose something from this cookbook and I’m guaranteed an excellent dish that m whole family (low carb or not) will enjoy. I’m so thankful to have this recipe book. Really exceptional! Thank you!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)

review: I LOVE Carolyn's cookbooks! All of the recipes are winners and fail-safe. Her desserts are fabulous and her main dishes are creative, but easy to make. My children have been picky, but they like her recipes! Thank you, Carolyn, for all you do for the Ketogenic lifestyle!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)

review: I'm new to the Keto lifestyle and I absolutely love Carolyn Ketchum's cookbook! I've been collecting a lot of Keto books lately and hers is by far the best I've seen. I'm excited to try so many of her recipes. Everything looks amazing. I made Salted Chocolate Macadamia Nut Fat Bombs today and they are SO delicious! I highly recommend this book!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: I love that the recipes in this book are written by ...
review:
I love that the recipes in this book are written by a real life Mom! She always has the best ideas for me when I'm on the go and out of inspiration. I bought both the hard copy, and digital version for on the go.

The best sweet, dinner ideas, and sides for anyone doing a Low carb or Ketogenic lifestyle.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Carolyn Makes it Easy!
review: I love, love, LOVE this cookbook. Carolyn's recipes are so easy to follow and don't call for a bunch of special ingredients like many of the keto cookbooks out there. She also gives time saving tips which, as a person who works full-time and then has to come home and cook, I definitely appreciate.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Absolutely LOVE this cookbook
review: Absolutely LOVE this cookbook. Has more than just recipes, though. Great pictures, advice and, if a book could have personality, I'd say, "Nailed it!" Buy it TODAY!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)

If you are or are starting a low carb/keto diet this is one of the books you definitely have to have in your kitchen.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)

The magic mozzarella dough is so versatile, and the maple bacon pancake muffins are to die for. If you are even slightly considering buying a keto cookbook, you need this one.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: There are so many meals/items in this book that are quick and easy, and I can take them with me for ...

There are so many meals/items in this book that are quick and easy, and I can take them with me for snacking while driving to deliveries.

review: The one thing I love about Carolyn's recipes is that they're so dependable. When I try recipes from others, they're always hit or miss. I love the recipes in this book and I use them often!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: I love this cookbook
review: I love this cookbook. I have several other Keto cookbooks, but this one is by far my favorite. I use it weekly and everything I have made so far has been delicious!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Recipes are gross, boring & uninspiring
review:
The Keto diet is NOT the answer to the growing problem of obesity, diabetes and other illnesses. Many people have lived long, healthy lives and remained within a "normal" weight range their whole lives by eating a wide variety of healthy food (including carbs), in moderation. The problem is people overeat or eat garbage and then turn to diets like Keto as a Band-Aid "fix" for their problems.

I'm an experienced cook (40+ yrs) with a wide range of tastes and foods. I'm interested in learning about various "diets" and lately I've been interested in the Keto diet but every cookbook I look at, it's the same old - same old. Carolyn Ketchum's book is no different. The recipes are bland, boring, repetitive, uninspiring and reminiscent of recipes in the 50's and 60's where you created "instant food" with ingredients you threw together. Just gross. Why not cook everything from scratch using only fresh, wholesome ingredients? (Cream cheese is processed food - sorry to disappoint... and so is shredded Mozzarella with a plethora of additives!) To be fair, the Keto diet is EXTREMELY restrictive in terms of what kinds of fruits & vegetables you can eat (never mind having to omit ALL grains) so that leaves very little in terms of choices for recipe creations. That being said, exactly how much cauliflower, zucchini and broccoli can one eat before one wants to gag? Better yet, before your body gets sick of it (and may even start rejecting it by developing a sensitivity or allergy to it? This is a well-known fact, anything you eat TOO much of becomes a target) The body needs a variety of nutrients (minerals, vitamins, etc..) that cannot be obtained by eating a small subset of foods. Hence why each and every fruit and vegetable provides a little of everything you need if you eat small amounts and rotate them seasonally.

I understand and respect the fact that this diet and lifestyle may work for some people but I find that the recipes have been "Keto-i-fied" to the point where they become gross. It would make more sense to find regular recipes and simply modify them slightly to remove (or lower) the high-carb elements instead of "Frankensteining" recipes to the point where they are unrecognizable. Cauliflower rice does NOT taste like real rice and Zucchini noodles do NOT taste like pasta no matter how much sauce I put on them. Swerve in any dessert tastes gross and I've tried every "sugar-free" sweetener on the market in my baking, all of which have failed miserably (much to the chagrin of my taste buds and wallet!)

It would make more sense if people simply learned how to cook real food using fresh ingredients and ate in moderation. Who knows what the long-term cumulative effects of eating a high fat/low carb diet will have on people's bodies. You won't know until it's too late. I shudder at the thought of what all that fat is doing to my arteries & heart. There's a reason why there's an abundance of natural fruits and vegetables in the world. Each one provides something our bodies need. Balance is the key, not restrictive diets (with recipes that make you want to gag). To each his own...

If you're into Keto dieting, find regular recipes that you can "adapt" to meet your low-carb needs and learn how to cook. You'll be better off than following the recipes in this book (or any Keto cookbook for that matter)

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Ehh
review: Not really inspiring recipes. Helpful for the keto beginner I guess but I haven't made even one of the recipes

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Recipes are gross, boring & uninspiring
review:
The Keto diet is NOT the answer to the growing problem of obesity, diabetes and other illnesses. Many people have lived long, healthy lives and remained within a "normal" weight range their whole lives by eating a wide variety of healthy food (including carbs), in moderation. The problem is people overeat or eat garbage and then turn to diets like Keto as a Band-Aid "fix" for their problems.

I'm an experienced cook (40+ yrs) with a wide range of tastes and foods. I'm interested in learning about various "diets" and lately I've been interested in the Keto diet but every cookbook I look at, it's the same old - same old. Carolyn Ketchum's book is no different. The recipes are bland, boring, repetitive, uninspiring and reminiscent of recipes in the 50's and 60's where you created "instant food" with ingredients you threw together. Just gross. Why not cook everything from scratch using only fresh, wholesome ingredients? (Cream cheese is processed food - sorry to disappoint... and so is shredded Mozzarella with a plethora of additives!) To be fair, the Keto diet is EXTREMELY restrictive in terms of what kinds of fruits & vegetables you can eat (never mind having to omit ALL grains) so that leaves very little in terms of choices for recipe creations. That being said, exactly how much cauliflower, zucchini and broccoli can one eat before one wants to gag? Better yet, before your body gets sick of it (and may even start rejecting it by developing a sensitivity or allergy to it? This is a well-known fact, anything you eat TOO much of becomes a target) The body needs a variety of nutrients (minerals, vitamins, etc..) that cannot be obtained by eating a small subset of foods. Hence why each and every fruit and vegetable provides a little of everything you need if you eat small amounts and rotate them seasonally.

I understand and respect the fact that this diet and lifestyle may work for some people but I find that the recipes have been "Keto-i-fied" to the point where they become gross. It would make more sense to find regular recipes and simply modify them slightly to remove (or lower) the high-carb elements instead of "Frankensteining" recipes to the point where they are unrecognizable. Cauliflower rice does NOT taste like real rice and Zucchini noodles do NOT taste like pasta no matter how much sauce I put on them. Swerve in any dessert tastes gross and I've tried every "sugar-free" sweetener on the market in my baking, all of which have failed miserably (much to the chagrin of my taste buds and wallet!)

It would make more sense if people simply learned how to cook real food using fresh ingredients and ate in moderation. Who knows what the long-term cumulative effects of eating a high fat/low carb diet will have on people's bodies. You won't know until it's too late. I shudder at the thought of what all that fat is doing to my arteries & heart. There's a reason why there's an abundance of natural fruits and vegetables in the world. Each one provides something our bodies need. Balance is the key, not restrictive diets (with recipes that make you want to gag). To each his own...

If you're into Keto dieting, find regular recipes that you can "adapt" to meet your low-carb needs and learn how to cook. You'll be better off than following the recipes in this book (or any Keto cookbook for that matter)

And I’m not sure if the book I purchased was used because there were some pages that were damaged, like shriveled.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: It's alright, not the best Keto book.
review: It's ok - this is written with many allergies in mind, not just Keto.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Recipes are gross, boring & uninspiring
review:
The Keto diet is NOT the answer to the growing problem of obesity, diabetes and other illnesses. Many people have lived long, healthy lives and remained within a "normal" weight range their whole lives by eating a wide variety of healthy food (including carbs), in moderation. The problem is people overeat or eat garbage and then turn to diets like Keto as a Band-Aid "fix" for their problems.

I'm an experienced cook (40+ yrs) with a wide range of tastes and foods. I'm interested in learning about various "diets" and lately I've been interested in the Keto diet but every cookbook I look at, it's the same old - same old. Carolyn Ketchum's book is no different. The recipes are bland, boring, repetitive, uninspiring and reminiscent of recipes in the 50's and 60's where you created "instant food" with ingredients you threw together. Just gross. Why not cook everything from scratch using only fresh, wholesome ingredients? (Cream cheese is processed food - sorry to disappoint... and so is shredded Mozzarella with a plethora of additives!) To be fair, the Keto diet is EXTREMELY restrictive in terms of what kinds of fruits & vegetables you can eat (never mind having to omit ALL grains) so that leaves very little in terms of choices for recipe creations. That being said, exactly how much cauliflower, zucchini and broccoli can one eat before one wants to gag? Better yet, before your body gets sick of it (and may even start rejecting it by developing a sensitivity or allergy to it? This is a well-known fact, anything you eat TOO much of becomes a target) The body needs a variety of nutrients (minerals, vitamins, etc..) that cannot be obtained by eating a small subset of foods. Hence why each and every fruit and vegetable provides a little of everything you need if you eat small amounts and rotate them seasonally.

I understand and respect the fact that this diet and lifestyle may work for some people but I find that the recipes have been "Keto-i-fied" to the point where they become gross. It would make more sense to find regular recipes and simply modify them slightly to remove (or lower) the high-carb elements instead of "Frankensteining" recipes to the point where they are unrecognizable. Cauliflower rice does NOT taste like real rice and Zucchini noodles do NOT taste like pasta no matter how much sauce I put on them. Swerve in any dessert tastes gross and I've tried every "sugar-free" sweetener on the market in my baking, all of which have failed miserably (much to the chagrin of my taste buds and wallet!)

It would make more sense if people simply learned how to cook real food using fresh ingredients and ate in moderation. Who knows what the long-term cumulative effects of eating a high fat/low carb diet will have on people's bodies. You won't know until it's too late. I shudder at the thought of what all that fat is doing to my arteries & heart. There's a reason why there's an abundance of natural fruits and vegetables in the world. Each one provides something our bodies need. Balance is the key, not restrictive diets (with recipes that make you want to gag). To each his own...

If you're into Keto dieting, find regular recipes that you can "adapt" to meet your low-carb needs and learn how to cook. You'll be better off than following the recipes in this book (or any Keto cookbook for that matter)

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Ehh
review: Not really inspiring recipes. Helpful for the keto beginner I guess but I haven't made even one of the recipes

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: ITS NOT WHAT I THOUGHT IT WAS GOING TO BE VERY BASIC
review: NOT WHAT I THOUGHT IT WAS GOING TO BE

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Great Cookbook for fans of Erythritol. ALL sweet recipes that looked good, have Erythritol.
review: Couldnt they have been a little more creative in offering at least a few ALL NATURAL recipes with no Erythritol?

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Waste of money
review: This book is a complete waste of money. It's full of recipes that use sugar alcohol and/or other ingredients that aren't even close to being healthy. Don't waste your money. At least I only spent $10 on the book. I've already deleted it from my Kindle.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: I love Carolyn's work
review: I love Carolyn's work, and her recipes have been staples in my house for a long time. I was excited to get her book, and disappointed to see that the printing is very poor. Many pages are printed strangely, and some of the words are quite fuzzy. I will still look forward to making some of the recipes in it however!

That being said, exactly how much cauliflower, zucchini and broccoli can one eat before one wants to gag? Better yet, before your body gets sick of it (and may even start rejecting it by developing a sensitivity or allergy to it? This is a well-known fact, anything you eat TOO much of becomes a target) The body needs a variety of nutrients (minerals, vitamins, etc..) that cannot be obtained by eating a small subset of foods. Hence why each and every fruit and vegetable provides a little of everything you need if you eat small amounts and rotate them seasonally.

I understand and respect the fact that this diet and lifestyle may work for some people but I find that the recipes have been "Keto-i-fied" to the point where they become gross. It would make more sense to find regular recipes and simply modify them slightly to remove (or lower) the high-carb elements instead of "Frankensteining" recipes to the point where they are unrecognizable. Cauliflower rice does NOT taste like real rice and Zucchini noodles do NOT taste like pasta no matter how much sauce I put on them. Swerve in any dessert tastes gross and I've tried every "sugar-free" sweetener on the market in my baking, all of which have failed miserably (much to the chagrin of my taste buds and wallet!)

It would make more sense if people simply learned how to cook real food using fresh ingredients and ate in moderation. Who knows what the long-term cumulative effects of eating a high fat/low carb diet will have on people's bodies. You won't know until it's too late. I shudder at the thought of what all that fat is doing to my arteries & heart. There's a reason why there's an abundance of natural fruits and vegetables in the world. Each one provides something our bodies need. Balance is the key, not restrictive diets (with recipes that make you want to gag). To each his own...

If you're into Keto dieting, find regular recipes that you can "adapt" to meet your low-carb needs and learn how to cook. You'll be better off than following the recipes in this book (or any Keto cookbook for that matter)

If you're into Keto dieting, find regular recipes that you can "adapt" to meet your low-carb needs and learn how to cook. You'll be better off than following the recipes in this book (or any Keto cookbook for that matter)

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Recipes are gross, boring & uninspiring
review:
The Keto diet is NOT the answer to the growing problem of obesity, diabetes and other illnesses. Many people have lived long, healthy lives and remained within a "normal" weight range their whole lives by eating a wide variety of healthy food (including carbs), in moderation. The problem is people overeat or eat garbage and then turn to diets like Keto as a Band-Aid "fix" for their problems.

I'm an experienced cook (40+ yrs) with a wide range of tastes and foods. I'm interested in learning about various "diets" and lately I've been interested in the Keto diet but every cookbook I look at, it's the same old - same old. Carolyn Ketchum's book is no different. The recipes are bland, boring, repetitive, uninspiring and reminiscent of recipes in the 50's and 60's where you created "instant food" with ingredients you threw together. Just gross. Why not cook everything from scratch using only fresh, wholesome ingredients? (Cream cheese is processed food - sorry to disappoint... and so is shredded Mozzarella with a plethora of additives!) To be fair, the Keto diet is EXTREMELY restrictive in terms of what kinds of fruits & vegetables you can eat (never mind having to omit ALL grains) so that leaves very little in terms of choices for recipe creations. That being said, exactly how much cauliflower, zucchini and broccoli can one eat before one wants to gag? Better yet, before your body gets sick of it (and may even start rejecting it by developing a sensitivity or allergy to it? This is a well-known fact, anything you eat TOO much of becomes a target) The body needs a variety of nutrients (minerals, vitamins, etc..) that cannot be obtained by eating a small subset of foods. Hence why each and every fruit and vegetable provides a little of everything you need if you eat small amounts and rotate them seasonally.

I understand and respect the fact that this diet and lifestyle may work for some people but I find that the recipes have been "Keto-i-fied" to the point where they become gross. It would make more sense to find regular recipes and simply modify them slightly to remove (or lower) the high-carb elements instead of "Frankensteining" recipes to the point where they are unrecognizable. Cauliflower rice does NOT taste like real rice and Zucchini noodles do NOT taste like pasta no matter how much sauce I put on them. Swerve in any dessert tastes gross and I've tried every "sugar-free" sweetener on the market in my baking, all of which have failed miserably (much to the chagrin of my taste buds and wallet!)

It would make more sense if people simply learned how to cook real food using fresh ingredients and ate in moderation. Who knows what the long-term cumulative effects of eating a high fat/low carb diet will have on people's bodies. You won't know until it's too late. I shudder at the thought of what all that fat is doing to my arteries & heart. There's a reason why there's an abundance of natural fruits and vegetables in the world. Each one provides something our bodies need. Balance is the key, not restrictive diets (with recipes that make you want to gag). To each his own...

If you're into Keto dieting, find regular recipes that you can "adapt" to meet your low-carb needs and learn how to cook. You'll be better off than following the recipes in this book (or any Keto cookbook for that matter)

review: I love Carolyn's work, and her recipes have been staples in my house for a long time. I was excited to get her book, and disappointed to see that the printing is very poor. Many pages are printed strangely, and some of the words are quite fuzzy. I will still look forward to making some of the recipes in it however!

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Just baking recipes.
review: I really wanted to like this book. Bad thing is it’s only about baking! I wanted to see more chicken,ribs,steak recipes. The book has wonderful amazing recipes but I’m a meat kind of girl. And I’m not sure if the book I purchased was used because there were some pages that were damaged, like shriveled.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: It's alright, not the best Keto book.
review: It's ok - this is written with many allergies in mind, not just Keto.

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Recipes are gross, boring & uninspiring
review:
The Keto diet is NOT the answer to the growing problem of obesity, diabetes and other illnesses. Many people have lived long, healthy lives and remained within a "normal" weight range their whole lives by eating a wide variety of healthy food (including carbs), in moderation. The problem is people overeat or eat garbage and then turn to diets like Keto as a Band-Aid "fix" for their problems.

I'm an experienced cook (40+ yrs) with a wide range of tastes and foods. I'm interested in learning about various "diets" and lately I've been interested in the Keto diet but every cookbook I look at, it's the same old - same old. Carolyn Ketchum's book is no different. The recipes are bland, boring, repetitive, uninspiring and reminiscent of recipes in the 50's and 60's where you created "instant food" with ingredients you threw together. Just gross. Why not cook everything from scratch using only fresh, wholesome ingredients? (Cream cheese is processed food - sorry to disappoint... and so is shredded Mozzarella with a plethora of additives!) To be fair, the Keto diet is EXTREMELY restrictive in terms of what kinds of fruits & vegetables you can eat (never mind having to omit ALL grains) so that leaves very little in terms of choices for recipe creations. That being said, exactly how much cauliflower, zucchini and broccoli can one eat before one wants to gag? Better yet, before your body gets sick of it (and may even start rejecting it by developing a sensitivity or allergy to it? This is a well-known fact, anything you eat TOO much of becomes a target) The body needs a variety of nutrients (minerals, vitamins, etc..) that cannot be obtained by eating a small subset of foods. Hence why each and every fruit and vegetable provides a little of everything you need if you eat small amounts and rotate them seasonally.

I understand and respect the fact that this diet and lifestyle may work for some people but I find that the recipes have been "Keto-i-fied" to the point where they become gross. It would make more sense to find regular recipes and simply modify them slightly to remove (or lower) the high-carb elements instead of "Frankensteining" recipes to the point where they are unrecognizable. Cauliflower rice does NOT taste like real rice and Zucchini noodles do NOT taste like pasta no matter how much sauce I put on them. Swerve in any dessert tastes gross and I've tried every "sugar-free" sweetener on the market in my baking, all of which have failed miserably (much to the chagrin of my taste buds and wallet!)

It would make more sense if people simply learned how to cook real food using fresh ingredients and ate in moderation. Who knows what the long-term cumulative effects of eating a high fat/low carb diet will have on people's bodies. You won't know until it's too late. I shudder at the thought of what all that fat is doing to my arteries & heart. There's a reason why there's an abundance of natural fruits and vegetables in the world. Each one provides something our bodies need. Balance is the key, not restrictive diets (with recipes that make you want to gag). To each his own...

If you're into Keto dieting, find regular recipes that you can "adapt" to meet your low-carb needs and learn how to cook. You'll be better off than following the recipes in this book (or any Keto cookbook for that matter)

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Ehh
review: Not really inspiring recipes. Helpful for the keto beginner I guess but I haven't made even one of the recipes

title: ITS NOT WHAT I THOUGHT IT WAS GOING TO BE VERY BASIC
review: NOT WHAT I THOUGHT IT WAS GOING TO BE

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Great Cookbook for fans of Erythritol. ALL sweet recipes that looked good, have Erythritol.
review: Couldnt they have been a little more creative in offering at least a few ALL NATURAL recipes with no Erythritol?

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Waste of money
review: This book is a complete waste of money. It's full of recipes that use sugar alcohol and/or other ingredients that aren't even close to being healthy. Don't waste your money. At least I only spent $10 on the book. I've already deleted it from my Kindle.

I'm interested in learning about various "diets" and lately I've been interested in the Keto diet but every cookbook I look at, it's the same old - same old. Carolyn Ketchum's book is no different. The recipes are bland, boring, repetitive, uninspiring and reminiscent of recipes in the 50's and 60's where you created "instant food" with ingredients you threw together. Just gross. Why not cook everything from scratch using only fresh, wholesome ingredients? (Cream cheese is processed food - sorry to disappoint... and so is shredded Mozzarella with a plethora of additives!) To be fair, the Keto diet is EXTREMELY restrictive in terms of what kinds of fruits & vegetables you can eat (never mind having to omit ALL grains) so that leaves very little in terms of choices for recipe creations. That being said, exactly how much cauliflower, zucchini and broccoli can one eat before one wants to gag? Better yet, before your body gets sick of it (and may even start rejecting it by developing a sensitivity or allergy to it? This is a well-known fact, anything you eat TOO much of becomes a target) The body needs a variety of nutrients (minerals, vitamins, etc..) that cannot be obtained by eating a small subset of foods. Hence why each and every fruit and vegetable provides a little of everything you need if you eat small amounts and rotate them seasonally.

I understand and respect the fact that this diet and lifestyle may work for some people but I find that the recipes have been "Keto-i-fied" to the point where they become gross. It would make more sense to find regular recipes and simply modify them slightly to remove (or lower) the high-carb elements instead of "Frankensteining" recipes to the point where they are unrecognizable. Cauliflower rice does NOT taste like real rice and Zucchini noodles do NOT taste like pasta no matter how much sauce I put on them. Swerve in any dessert tastes gross and I've tried every "sugar-free" sweetener on the market in my baking, all of which have failed miserably (much to the chagrin of my taste buds and wallet!)

It would make more sense if people simply learned how to cook real food using fresh ingredients and ate in moderation. Who knows what the long-term cumulative effects of eating a high fat/low carb diet will have on people's bodies. You won't know until it's too late. I shudder at the thought of what all that fat is doing to my arteries & heart. There's a reason why there's an abundance of natural fruits and vegetables in the world. Each one provides something our bodies need. Balance is the key, not restrictive diets (with recipes that make you want to gag). To each his own...

If you're into Keto dieting, find regular recipes that you can "adapt" to meet your low-carb needs and learn how to cook. You'll be better off than following the recipes in this book (or any Keto cookbook for that matter)

It would make more sense if people simply learned how to cook real food using fresh ingredients and ate in moderation. Who knows what the long-term cumulative effects of eating a high fat/low carb diet will have on people's bodies. You won't know until it's too late. I shudder at the thought of what all that fat is doing to my arteries & heart. There's a reason why there's an abundance of natural fruits and vegetables in the world. Each one provides something our bodies need. Balance is the key, not restrictive diets (with recipes that make you want to gag). To each his own...

If you're into Keto dieting, find regular recipes that you can "adapt" to meet your low-carb needs and learn how to cook. You'll be better off than following the recipes in this book (or any Keto cookbook for that matter)

book_title: The Everyday Ketogenic Kitchen: With More than 150 Inspirational Low-Carb, High-Fat Recipes to Maximize Your Health (1)
title: Recipes are gross, boring & uninspiring
review:
The Keto diet is NOT the answer to the growing problem of obesity, diabetes and other illnesses. Many people have lived long, healthy lives and remained within a "normal" weight range their whole lives by eating a wide variety of healthy food (including carbs), in moderation. The problem is people overeat or eat garbage and then turn to diets like Keto as a Band-Aid "fix" for their problems.

I'm an experienced cook (40+ yrs) with a wide range of tastes and foods. I'm interested in learning about various "diets" and lately I've been interested in the Keto diet but every cookbook I look at, it's the same old - same old. Carolyn Ketchum's book is no different. The recipes are bland, boring, repetitive, uninspiring and reminiscent of recipes in the 50's and 60's where you created "instant food" with ingredients you threw together. Just gross. Why not cook everything from scratch using only fresh, wholesome ingredients? (Cream cheese is processed food - sorry to disappoint... and so is shredded Mozzarella with a plethora of additives!) To be fair, the Keto diet is EXTREMELY restrictive in terms of what kinds of fruits & vegetables you can eat (never mind having to omit ALL grains) so that leaves very little in terms of choices for recipe creations. That being said, exactly how much cauliflower, zucchini and broccoli can one eat before one wants to gag? Better yet, before your body gets sick of it (and may even start rejecting it by developing a sensitivity or allergy to it? This is a well-known fact, anything you eat TOO much of becomes a target) The body needs a variety of nutrients (minerals, vitamins, etc..) that cannot be obtained by eating a small subset of foods. Hence why each and every fruit and vegetable provides a little of everything you need if you eat small amounts and rotate them seasonally.

I understand and respect the fact that this diet and lifestyle may work for some people but I find that the recipes have been "Keto-i-fied" to the point where they become gross. It would make more sense to find regular recipes and simply modify them slightly to remove (or lower) the high-carb elements instead of "Frankensteining" recipes to the point where they are unrecognizable. Cauliflower rice does NOT taste like real rice and Zucchini noodles do NOT taste like pasta no matter how much sauce I put on them. Swerve in any dessert tastes gross and I've tried every "sugar-free" sweetener on the market in my baking, all of which have failed miserably (much to the chagrin of my taste buds and wallet!)

It would make more sense if people simply learned how to cook real food using fresh ingredients and ate in moderation. Who knows what the long-term cumulative effects of eating a high fat/low carb diet will have on people's bodies. You won't know until it's too late. I shudder at the thought of what all that fat is doing to my arteries & heart. There's a reason why there's an abundance of natural fruits and vegetables in the world. Each one provides something our bodies need. Balance is the key, not restrictive diets (with recipes that make you want to gag). To each his own...

If you're into Keto dieting, find regular recipes that you can "adapt" to meet your low-carb needs and learn how to cook. You'll be better off than following the recipes in this book (or any Keto cookbook for that matter)
